word.chinese: [動詞] 放棄; [名詞] 放縱;放任

sentence.english: An abbreviation for formula calculation language, a high-level programming language not too widely used.

sentence.english: It's hard to measure his ability when we haven't seen his work.

sentence.english: Free will makes us able to choose our way of life.

word.chinese: [副詞] 在船(或飛機;車)上;上船(或飛機;車); [介係詞] 上(船,飛機,車);在(船,飛機,車)上

sentence.english: We travelled aboard the same flight.

sentence.chinese: 請上船
sentence.english: All aboard!

sentence.english: A member of an aboriginal people living in tribes.

sentence.english: Any of the languages of the aboriginal peoples of Australia.

sentence.english: The abortion issue is political dynamite.

sentence.chinese: 叢林中有大量的熱帶植物。

sentence.english: His conduct has always been above suspicion.

sentence.english: Professor Li is absent, I will take the lesson in the place of him.

sentence.chinese: 她的新連衣裙漂亮極了。
sentence.english: Her new dress is an absolute dream.

sentence.chinese: 呼語直接稱呼不在場或虛構的人物或稱呼擬人的事物，尤指作為演講或作文過程中的離題話
sentence.english: The direct address of an absent or imaginary person or of a personified abstraction, especially as a digression in the course of a speech or composition.

sentence.english: British actor and theatrical producer who founded the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art(1904).

sentence.chinese: 領先者在其餘賽跑者加速時就逐漸失去了優勢。

sentence.english: A program that allows a user to perform work on a computer(in contrast to a program that performs overhead functions, such as an operating system). Examples are database managers, spreadsheets, and accounting programs.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 第一流的;突出的; [動詞] 發球得分;表現卓越; [名詞] (紙牌)A;麼點牌;專家;發球得分

sentence.chinese: 我不得不承認他的論據有力。

sentence.chinese: 很多青少年患有痤瘡[長粉刺]。
sentence.english: Many adolescents suffer from/have acne.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 聽覺的;音響的; [名詞] 發音響的器具

sentence.chinese: 非電傳音樂器

sentence.english: Italian mathematician and physicist who invented the mercury barometer.

sentence.english: I am filled with desire to go back home.

sentence.chinese: 書桌上有三本書。
sentence.english: There are three books on the desk.

sentence.chinese: 演講者在他面前的桌子上放著一疊筆記。
sentence.english: The speaker had a sheaf of notes on the desk in front of him.

word.chinese: [動詞] 絕望,喪失信心; [名詞] 絕望

sentence.chinese: 他已陷入絕望的深淵。
sentence.english: He has been in the abyss of despair.

sentence.chinese: 一個人在絕望時最失望。
sentence.english: A person is most disappointed when he is in despair.

sentence.chinese: 倘若外援枯竭，形勢將極為嚴重。
sentence.english: If foreign aid dries up the situation will be desperate.

sentence.chinese: 他極想喝一杯水。
sentence.english: He's desperate for a glass of water.

sentence.chinese: 他宣稱蔑視錢財。
sentence.english: He claims to despise riches.

sentence.chinese: 實踐與理論一樣重要，但是我們易於珍視後者而輕視前者。
sentence.english: Practice is as important as theory, but we are apt to value the latter and despise the former.

sentence.chinese: 儘管我們盡了全力，我們還是輸掉了比賽。
sentence.english: Despite all our efforts we still lost the game.

sentence.chinese: 她不管遇到什麼情況都竭力保持著幽默感。
sentence.english: She managed despite everything to preserve her sense of humour.

sentence.chinese: 他給我們吃核桃仁巧克力餅作為甜點。
sentence.english: He served us brownies as dessert.

sentence.chinese: 柑橘椰子甜食一種主要由橘子和椰片做成的甜食
sentence.english: A dessert containing primarily oranges and flaked coconut.

sentence.chinese: 長途汽車要繞很多彎路才到達目的地。
sentence.english: The coach followed a rather devious course to its destination.

sentence.chinese: 終點已經在望。
sentence.english: The destination is in view.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 命中注定的;(場所)預定的

sentence.chinese: 命運注定他們永不再相逢。
sentence.english: They were destined never to meet again.

sentence.chinese: 這條船將開往紐約。
sentence.english: This ship is destined for New York.

sentence.chinese: 你的命運已和我的命運結合在一起了。
sentence.english: Your destiny is interwoven with mine.

sentence.chinese: 有些人相信，命運之神支配人類的命運。
sentence.english: Some people believe that the Fates preside over man's destiny.

sentence.chinese: 這棵樹向那邊倒下就會把那所房子壓壞。
sentence.english: If the tree falls that way, it will destroy the house.

sentence.chinese: 敵人在逃往國外前，妄圖把所有工廠都毀掉。
sentence.english: Before they fled the country, the enemy vainly attempted to destroy all the factories.

sentence.chinese: 我們都為毀掉心愛的建築物而痛惜。
sentence.english: We all mourn the destruction of a well-loved building.

sentence.chinese: 這些大森林的毀壞會帶來生態上的嚴重後果。
sentence.english: The destruction of these big forests could have serious ecological consequences.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 破壞的;毀滅性的

sentence.chinese: 蝗蟲是一種害蟲。
sentence.english: A locust is a kind of destructive insect.

sentence.chinese: 有效的行為有效的、懲罰的或破壞性的行為
sentence.english: Effective, punitive, or destructive action.

sentence.chinese: 許多士兵被派去保護這座建築物。
sentence.english: A number of soldiers were detached to guard the building.

sentence.chinese: 他從鏈子上拆下一個鏈環。
sentence.english: He detached a link from a chain.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 分離的;不帶感情的

sentence.chinese: 我從錶鏈上解下手錶。
sentence.english: I detached my watch from the chain.

sentence.chinese: 派遣了一些士兵守衛右翼。
sentence.english: A number of men were detached to guard the right flank.

word.chinese: [動詞] 詳述,詳細說明; [名詞] 細節;詳情

sentence.chinese: 協議的細節尚未公佈。
sentence.english: The full details of the agreement haven't been made public.

sentence.chinese: 請把你的各項開支列在這張表格上，好嗎？
sentence.english: Could you detail all your expenses on this form?

sentence.chinese: 哥倫布按順序仔細而詳盡地記載了他的各次航程。
sentence.english: Columbus kept a careful and detailed chronicle of his voyages.

sentence.chinese: 司令員對地形作了仔細研究。
sentence.english: The commander made a detailed study of the terrain.

sentence.chinese: 扣押，拘留拘留的行為
sentence.english: The act of detaining.

sentence.chinese: 檢疫期，隔離期當運輸工具、人或材料被懷疑帶有傳染性疾病，被扣留在港口進行強行隔離的一段期限，以防止疾病傳入某個國家
sentence.english: A period of time during which a vehicle, person, or material suspected of carrying a contagious disease is detained at a port of entry under enforced isolation to prevent disease from entering a country.

sentence.chinese: 我覺得這話有點兒像反話吧?
sentence.english: Do I detect a tinge of irony?

sentence.chinese: 我聽出那話裡有點兒忌妒之意吧?
sentence.english: Do I detect a touch of jaundice (ie a slight hint of jealousy, etc) in that remark?

sentence.chinese: 用於修飾或說明與故障或錯誤的檢測和隔離有關的特性。
sentence.english: Pertaining to the detection and isolation of a malfunction or mistake.

sentence.chinese: 警察組成這樣一個部門的一群人，他們被專門訓練來掌握執行法律和防止並偵破犯罪行為的方法，被授予維護一個社區的和平、安全和秩序的職權
sentence.english: A body of persons making up such a department, trained in methods of law enforcement and crime prevention and detection and given the authority to maintain the peace, safety, and order of the community.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 偵查用的;探測用的; [名詞] 偵探;私家偵探

sentence.chinese: 福爾摩斯也沒有你本事大--你是真的偵探。
sentence.english: Sherlock Holmes has nothing on you you're a real detective.

sentence.chinese: 那偵探佯裝成弔唁者參加了受害人的葬禮。
sentence.english: The detective posed as a mourner at the victim's funeral.

sentence.chinese: (運輸工具)滯留，延期船、貨車或其他運輸工具在裝卸貨物期間超過了規定的離開時間而滯留
sentence.english: Detention of a ship, freight car, or other cargo conveyance during loading or unloading beyond the scheduled time of departure.

sentence.chinese: 自立擺脫了被奴役、扣押或壓迫的人的自由
sentence.english: Liberty of the person from slavery, detention, or oppression.

sentence.chinese: 許多因素造成了新工業無法進入這座城市。
sentence.english: Several factors deter new industry from coming to the city.

sentence.chinese: 苔絲一次又一次的嚴辭拒絕未能制止亞歷克，他整天纏住苔絲，先是用結婚證書和神聖的誓言來說服她。
sentence.english: Repulse after repulse failed to deter Alec, who persisted day by day, at first with a marriage license and holy words.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 去垢的,使潔淨的; [名詞] 洗潔劑,洗衣粉

sentence.chinese: 我試用了這種新型洗滌劑，效果很好。
sentence.english: I've tried this new detergent with excellent results.

sentence.chinese: 注意務必沖洗掉這些盤子上的清潔劑。
sentence.english: Be careful to rinse the detergent from these dishes.

word.chinese: [動詞] 惡化;(價值)下降;退化;墮落

sentence.chinese: 食物在夏天容易變質。
sentence.english: Food is apt to deteriorate in summer.

sentence.chinese: 最近幾週那兩個國家間的關係嚴重惡化了。
sentence.english: Relation between the two countries have deteriorated sharply in recent week.

sentence.chinese: 變性特定的組織、細胞或器官隨著受傷、疾病或年老而導致的相應的功能的削弱或喪失，而形成的逐漸的變質
sentence.english: Gradual deterioration of specific tissues, cells, or organs with corresponding impairment or loss of function, caused by injury, disease, or aging.

sentence.chinese: 墮落在道德或藝術方面變壞，或衰落的過程、條件、或期間; 衰敗
sentence.english: A process, condition, or period of deterioration or decline, as in morals or art; decay.

sentence.chinese: 他靠堅定的信心度過了難關。
sentence.english: His determination carried him through (the ordeal).

sentence.chinese: 他很堅定地正視這一大堆工作。
sentence.english: He confronted his pile of work with determination.

sentence.chinese: 政府決定同國際恐怖主義作鬥爭。
sentence.english: The government is determined to combat international terrorism.

sentence.chinese: 政府決心把通貨膨脹率降低。
sentence.english: The government is determined to bring down inflation.

word.chinese: [動詞] 降低價值;(貨幣)貶值

sentence.chinese: 我們不可不公正地貶低他的作品。
sentence.english: Let's not devalue his work unjustly.

sentence.chinese: 不公正地貶低任何人的工作都是不公平的。
sentence.english: It's unfair to devalue anyone's work unjustly.

sentence.chinese: 她因他去世而悲痛欲絕。
sentence.english: She was devastated by his death.

sentence.chinese: 我獲悉失事的消息感到十分震驚。
sentence.english: I was devastated by the news of the wreck.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 破壞性極大的;毀滅性的

sentence.chinese: 這個地區常遭破壞性季風的襲擊。
sentence.english: The area is subject to devastating seasonal winds.
動詞 devastate:

sentence.chinese: 他成長為一名堅強的領導人。
sentence.english: He developed into a strong leader.

sentence.chinese: 現代音樂最初是在意大利發展起來的。
sentence.english: Modern music was first developed in Italy.

word.chinese: [形容詞] (國家、地區)發達的;先進的;成熟的

sentence.chinese: 解放後這個地區的畜牧業得到了巨大的發展。
sentence.english: The animal husbandry in this area has developed greatly after liberation.

sentence.chinese: 她長成了一位漂亮的女人。
sentence.english: She developed into a beautiful woman.

sentence.chinese: 那個土地開發投資人幹了很多非法的交易。
sentence.english: The land developer do a lot of under-the-table wheel and dealing.

sentence.chinese: 一個房屋建築商說，“如果你是一個照章行事的包商，你的事就別想順利辦成。“
sentence.english: 「If you are a contractor playing it straight,you can have a hard time getting things done,」 a housing developer said.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 發展中的,開發中的

sentence.chinese: 這個城市在飛速發展，市中心的房地產價格越來越貴。
sentence.english: The city is developing rapidly and property in the center is becoming more expensive.

sentence.chinese: 開發超音速噴氣機是一項了不起的成就。
sentence.english: Developing the supersonic jet was quite an accomplishment.

sentence.chinese: 該城市已被定為開發區。
sentence.english: The town has been designated a development area.

sentence.chinese: 經濟制裁不能阻礙那個國家的發展。
sentence.english: The economic sanctions could not prevent the development of that country.

sentence.chinese: 縱使大眾也曾偏向正途也罷，那總是出於錯誤的原因。
sentence.english: If the multitude ever deviate into the right, it is always for the wrong reason.

sentence.chinese: 變異的傾向於偏離，如從一個正常的或被承認了的類型; 畸變的
sentence.english: Tending to deviate, as from a normal or recognized type; aberrant.

sentence.chinese: 該裝置將於年底投入生產。
sentence.english: The device will be in production by the end of the year.

sentence.chinese: 商標，牌號標明產品的名字、符號或其它設計，經過正式註冊，並只合法地限於其擁有者或製造商使用
sentence.english: A name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer.

sentence.chinese: 我修我這輛汽車可費勁了。
sentence.english: I'm having a devil of a job fixing my car.

sentence.chinese: 結婚後不久她就發現她丈夫是一個邪惡的人。
sentence.english: She found out her husband was a devil soon after her marriage.

sentence.chinese: 他的妻子瓊是一個健壯、淺薄的女人，也是孩子們隨和的母親。當她一聽說自己高貴的地位時，便立刻想入非非，暗自打算為她的年輕漂亮的女兒找一個顯赫、門當戶對的婆家。
sentence.english: And no sooner had Joan, his handsome, shallow-minded wife, the easy-going mother of his many children, heard of her exalted estate than her romantic soul began secretly to devise a brilliant and fitting alliance for her beautiful young daughter.

sentence.chinese: 他發明了一種新的晶體管。
sentence.english: He devises a new type of transistor.

sentence.chinese: 能為之獻身的最崇高的理想是共產主義。
sentence.english: The noblest ideal to which one can devote oneself is Communism.

sentence.chinese: 他開始研究生態學,並決心將他的一生獻身於這門學科。
sentence.english: He started to study ecology and decided to devote his whole life to the science.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 獻身的;專心致志的

sentence.chinese: 他的一生都奉獻給了中國的航空事業。
sentence.english: He devoted all his life to China's aviation.

sentence.chinese: 他一生耽於肉慾。
sentence.english: He lived a life devoted entirely to sensual pleasure.

sentence.chinese: 他那惺惺作態的愚忠使她惱火。
sentence.english: His apish devotion irritated her.

sentence.chinese: 一項事業需要我們畢生的奉獻。
sentence.english: A career needs our devotion all our lives.

word.chinese: [動詞] 狼吞虎嚥地吃;吞沒

sentence.chinese: 火焰吞沒了整棟大樓。
sentence.english: The flames devoured the entire building.

sentence.chinese: 他坐在火爐旁，狼吞虎嚥地吃著牛肉和洋蔥。
sentence.english: He sat by the fire, devouring beef and onions.

sentence.chinese: 草上沾滿了露珠。
sentence.english: The grass was sprinkled with dew.

sentence.chinese: 在詩歌中，人生被比喻為朝露。
sentence.english: Life is poetically compared to the morning dew.

sentence.chinese: 醫生診斷出麻疹。
sentence.english: The doctor diagnosed measles.

word.chinese: [名詞] 診斷;診斷書;調查分析

sentence.chinese: 工程師對橋的倒塌做一次徹底的調查分析。
sentence.english: The engineer made a complete diagnosis of the bridge's collapse.

sentence.chinese: 只有排除了胃潰瘍和十二指腸潰瘍的可能性之後，才能作出明確診斷。
sentence.english: A positive diagnosis can be made only after ruling out gastric and duodenal ulcer.

sentence.chinese: 該圖表本身即很清楚。
sentence.english: The diagram is self-explanatory.

sentence.chinese: 我得修改圖表。我出了點兒錯。
sentence.english: I'll have to alter the diagram. I've made a mistake.

word.chinese: [動詞] 撥(電話號碼); [名詞] 刻度盤;調節器;撥號盤

sentence.chinese: 刻度尺、 刻度盤、 量規等顯示的讀數是多少?
sentence.english: What does the scale, dial, gauge, etc read?

sentence.chinese: 刻度盤顯示出壓力有微小變化。
sentence.english: The dial records very slight variations in pressure.

sentence.chinese: 他講話中時而不自覺地冒出地方方言。
sentence.english: Every now and then he would lapse into the local dialect.

sentence.chinese: 她說一口方言，不是標準英語。
sentence.english: She speaks a dialect, not the Queen's English.

sentence.chinese: 由對話控制提供的一種功能。為進行差錯校正和其它目的，把信息分組後放入鏈中。
sentence.english: A facility provided in dialog control. Messages are grouped into chains for error recovery and other purposes.

sentence.chinese: 我們兩國最後終於能理智地進行對話了。
sentence.english: At last there can be a reasonable dialog between our two governments.

sentence.chinese: 圓的軸線是其直徑。
sentence.english: The axis of a circle is its diameter.

sentence.chinese: 我們必須先測量電線的直徑。
sentence.english: We must gauge the diameter of wire first.

sentence.chinese: 她在新衣服上戴了一枚鑽石別針。
sentence.english: She wore a diamond clip on her new dress.

sentence.chinese: 她從收藏品中挑選了一枚鑽石戒指。
sentence.english: She selected a diamond ring from the collection.

sentence.chinese: 用後即丟棄的物品，一次性物品用後即可丟棄的物品，如紙制尿布或皮下注射器
sentence.english: An article, such as a paper diaper or hypodermic syringe, that can be disposed of after one use.

sentence.chinese: 剛喂完奶，換了尿布，卻又在哭了！
sentence.english: I just nurse him and changed his diaper, and he's crying again!

sentence.chinese: 那個好事的傢伙偷看我的日記，讓我給抓個正著。
sentence.english: I caught that Nosey Parker reading my diary.

sentence.chinese: 他的父親規定他要用英文寫日記。
sentence.english: His father ordered that he (should) keep a diary in English.

sentence.chinese: 她因其技術奇貨可居，故可以主宰自己的薪金待遇。
sentence.english: Her skills were in such demand that she could dictate her own salary.

sentence.chinese: 老師給全班同學聽寫一段文章。
sentence.english: The teacher dictated a passage to the class.

sentence.chinese: 如果我總是不得不作他的口授記錄員，我會感到討厭的。
sentence.english: I hated it if I ever had to take dictation from him.

sentence.chinese: 在口述記錄設備上，從記錄媒體上擦除記錄的處理過程。
sentence.english: On dictation equipment, the process of removing the recording from a recording medium.

sentence.chinese: 這個獨裁者把所有反對他的活動均視為非法加以鎮壓。
sentence.english: The dictator represses all opposition as illegal.

sentence.chinese: 那獨裁者患有誇大狂。
sentence.english: The dictator was suffering from megalomania.

sentence.chinese: 那個國家當時正處在軍事獨裁統治之下。
sentence.english: The country was then living under a military dictatorship.

sentence.chinese: 那個國家現在正處於軍事獨裁統治之下。
sentence.english: That country is now living under a military dictatorship.

sentence.chinese: 詞書編纂者必須精於給詞語下定義的技巧。
sentence.english: Dictionary writers must be skilled in the art of definition.

sentence.chinese: 嚴格地說，那不是一本字典，而是一本語法書。
sentence.english: That is not, properly speaking, a dictionary but a grammar book.

sentence.chinese: 太好玩了，我差點笑死了。
sentence.english: It was so funny, I nearly died laughing.

sentence.chinese: 這種蛾子因棲息地正受到破壞，幾乎絕種了。
sentence.english: The moth's habitat is being destroyed and it has nearly died out.

sentence.chinese: 拖拉機一種以汽油或柴油發動機為動力的車輛，有巨大沉重的履帶，用於割草，農耕或其他用途
sentence.english: A vehicle, powered by a gasoline or diesel motor, having large heavily treaded tires, and used in mowing, farming, or other applications.

sentence.chinese: 柴油潛艇在水下只能航行非常短的時間，而核潛艇在水下航行的時間要長得多。
sentence.english: A diesel submarine is able to cruise under water for a short period of time, but a nuclear one is able to cruise under water much longer.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 節食的; [動詞] 節食; [名詞] 飲食;特種飲食

sentence.chinese: 你應該多吃些高蛋白食物。
sentence.english: You should eat more high-protein diet.

sentence.chinese: 我正在節食。
sentence.english: I'm on a diet.

sentence.chinese: 他們的意見分歧很大。
sentence.english: They differ widely in their opinions.

sentence.chinese: 我們的思想不同。
sentence.english: Our ideologies differ.

sentence.chinese: 你今天或明天去沒有多大關係。
sentence.english: It won't make much difference whether you go today or tomorrow.

sentence.chinese: 這房間有沒有花沒什麼區別。
sentence.english: Flowers make no difference to this room.

sentence.chinese: 兩位醫生對我的病作出了不同的診斷。
sentence.english: The two doctors made different diagnosis of my disease.

sentence.chinese: 我丈夫有好幾件顏色不同的襯衫。
sentence.english: My husband has several shirts of different colors.

sentence.chinese: 人物之間的區別沒有明顯刻劃出來。
sentence.english: One character is not clearly differentiated from another.

sentence.chinese: 那種鳥雄鳥的喙呈橙色，與雌鳥不同。
sentence.english: The male's orange beak differentiates it from the female.

sentence.chinese: 尋找金礦是很困難的。
sentence.english: The quest for gold was difficult.

sentence.chinese: 就英文而言，它並不像你所認為的那樣難。
sentence.english: So far as English is concerned, it is not so difficult as you might think.

sentence.chinese: 那位年輕的老師很難讓孩子們聽話。
sentence.english: The young teacher had difficulty in holding the children under her girdle.

sentence.chinese: 他申請出國簽證經歷了很大的困難。
sentence.english: He experienced great difficulty in getting a visa to leave the country.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使(熱、氣味等)四散;使滲出

sentence.english: A diffuse mass of interstellar dust or gas or both, visible as luminous patches or areas of darkness depending on the way the mass absorbs or reflects incident radiation.

sentence.chinese: 我花了一些時間才把聽到的東西弄明白。

sentence.chinese: 在釋文2。中所說的由一位或幾位數字表示的數。
sentence.english: The number represented by the digit or digits in2.

sentence.chinese: 用於修飾或說明涉及多位數字的運算。
sentence.english: Pertaining to an operation involving more than one digit.

sentence.chinese: 在數字信號技術中，用正(或負)向電壓與地兩個電平來表示二進制「1」和「0」的一種信號
sentence.english: In digital signal technique, a signal that uses a positive(or negative) excursion and ground as the two binary signal states.

sentence.chinese: [諺]勤力佳運之母。

word.chinese: [名詞] (長;寬;厚;高等的)尺寸;大小

sentence.english: My friend invited me to dine out.

sentence.english: Because my husband has gone to a stag dinner, I have to stay at home alone.

sentence.chinese: 自然歷史博物館專門搞了一次恐龍展覽。
sentence.english: The natural history museum have a special exhibition of dinosaur.

word.chinese: [動詞] 浸;泡; [名詞] (價格的)下跌

sentence.chinese: 有些人回到學校去接受教育，是想再取得一個學位或一張文憑，以增強自己在社會上的地位。

sentence.english: The phrase 「secret diplomacy」 has long been a red rag to American public opinion.

sentence.english: The exercise of patience is essential in diplomatic negotiations.

sentence.english: The two countries were on the point of war due to the diplomatic disputes.

sentence.english: I prefer to deal with him direct.

sentence.english: Can you see where the grammar books are? The dictionaries are on the shelf directly opposite.

word.chinese: [名詞] 董事;局長;主任;導演

sentence.english: He thumbed through the directory to look for her number.

sentence.english: A physical or mental disability.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使失去能力;使傷殘

sentence.chinese: 陷阱用來捕獲大動物的陷阱，其中準備重物落下並殺死或使獵物就範

sentence.chinese: 那個腿部受傷致殘的士兵正沉浸在悲哀之中。

sentence.chinese: 那個腿部受傷致殘的士兵正沉浸在悲哀之中。
sentence.english: The soldier disabled by wounds in his leg is buried in sadness.

sentence.chinese: 不吸菸的人往往不讚成別人在公共場合吸菸。

sentence.chinese: 這件災難使他對信仰發生了動搖。

sentence.chinese: 我懷著一種既好笑又不相信的複雜心情聽了他的辯解。
sentence.english: I listened to his excuse with a mixture of amusement and disbelief.

word.chinese: [動詞] 拋棄,摒棄,丟棄; [名詞] 拋棄,丟棄

sentence.chinese: 我馬上察覺出那人在撒謊。
sentence.english: I soon discerned that the man was lying.

sentence.chinese: 他在黑暗中只能勉強辨認出道路。
sentence.english: He was just able to discern the road from the dark.

word.chinese: [動詞] 卸貨;發射;排出;釋放;解雇; [名詞] 卸貨;發射;排出;釋放;解雇

sentence.english: They discharged their arrows at the enemy.

sentence.chinese: 卸貨需要多久？
sentence.english: How long will the discharge of the cargo take?

sentence.chinese: 他是英國聖公會的一名虔誠的信徒。
sentence.english: He is a devout disciple of the Episcopal Church.

sentence.chinese: 作曲家瓦格那的崇拜者或門徒
sentence.english: An admirer or a disciple of Richard Wagner.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 訓練的;紀律的;懲戒的

sentence.chinese: 自製遵守紀律訓練而養成的克制行為; 自控
sentence.english: Controlled behavior resulting from disciplinary training; self-control.

sentence.chinese: 大學評議會某些學院和大學中由全體教員及有學銜的行政人員，有時還有學生代表，組成的管理，顧問，或紀律機構
sentence.english: A governing, advisory, or disciplinary body of some colleges and universities composed of faculty members and sometimes student representatives.

word.chinese: [動詞] 懲戒; [名詞] 紀律,風紀;教養

sentence.chinese: 孩子們在學校裡很快活，但很散漫。
sentence.english: The children are happy at the school, but they lack discipline.

sentence.chinese: 他的軍隊是一支訓練有素的隊伍。
sentence.english: His army is a very disciplined force.

sentence.chinese: 報告披露他曾坐過牢。
sentence.english: The report disclosed that he had served in prison.

sentence.chinese: 當局終於向新聞界公開了真相。
sentence.english: The authorities finally disclosed the truth to the press.

sentence.chinese: 公開他曾坐牢一事斷送了他謀求在政府機構任職的機會。
sentence.english: The disclosure that he had been in prison ruined his chance for public office.

sentence.chinese: 絕密極其保密的信息，任何不經許可的揭密都會對國家安全造成最嚴重的危脅
sentence.english: Containing information, the unauthorized disclosure of which poses the gravest threat to national security.

sentence.chinese: 我們跟著迪斯科樂曲跳舞。
sentence.english: We danced to the disco music.

sentence.chinese: 來參加迪斯科舞會吧! 別再當老頑固了！
sentence.english: Come to the disco and stop being such an old fogey!

sentence.chinese: 止痛的、緩和的能緩解疼痛或不適的
sentence.english: Capable of easing pain or discomfort.

sentence.chinese: 我因為旅行的不適而感到不快。
sentence.english: I was unhappy because of the discomforts of travel.

sentence.chinese: 若不付費用,他們就會停止供應電力/煤氣。
sentence.english: If you don't pay your bills they'll disconnect your electricity/gas.

word.chinese: [動詞] 將...打折扣; [名詞] 折扣

sentence.chinese: 這些貨物將減價出售。
sentence.english: These goods will be sold at a discount.

sentence.chinese: 持會員證購物可享受折扣優待。
sentence.english: On production of your membership card, you will receive a discount on purchases.

sentence.chinese: 一項反對種族歧視的新法律已被提出。
sentence.english: A new law has been brought in to discourage racial prejudice.

sentence.chinese: 不要讓屬下對你這樣不拘禮儀。
sentence.english: Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates.

sentence.chinese: 後來發現他原來是間諜。
sentence.english: He was later discovered to have been a spy.

sentence.chinese: 據說哥倫佈於1492年發現了美洲。
sentence.english: Columbus is said to have discovered America in 1492.

sentence.chinese: 那項發現在科學界引起極大的震動。
sentence.english: The discovery caused a tremendous commotion in the scientific world.

sentence.chinese: 她發覺丈夫對自己不忠而猛醒。
sentence.english: The discovery that her husband was unfaithful to her was a rude (ie shocking) awakening.

word.chinese: [動詞] 敗壞名聲;使不足信; [名詞] 名聲的敗壞;信用的喪失

sentence.chinese: 他企圖敗壞對手名聲反而自食其果，被控以誹謗罪。
sentence.english: His attempt to discredit his opponent boomeranged (on him) when he was charged with libel.

sentence.chinese: 警察來得太晚了，真丟人。
sentence.english: The police, to their discredit, arrived too late.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 謹慎的;謙虛的;不引人注意的

sentence.chinese: 要更謹慎些－－否則你就會成為人們的話柄。
sentence.english: Be more discreet or you'll get yourself talked about.

sentence.chinese: 我在談話中當然會十分小心的。
sentence.english: I'll certainly be most discreet in my conversation.

sentence.chinese: 我以為我已經有矛盾之處作了辯解，但是他掌握了確鑿的數字，因此當他把控我說謊時，我毫無招架之勢。
sentence.english: I thought I had explained away the discrepancy but he had the actual figure and so I left myself wide open to a charge of telling lies.

sentence.chinese: 貨物標籤上寫的是一百美元,你向我索價一百二十美元,這個差異該怎麼解釋？
sentence.english: The price tag says$100 and you charged me for$120; how do you explain the discrepancy?

word.chinese: [形容詞] 分離的;不連接的

sentence.chinese: 用於修飾或說明一種設備(工作特性)的術語，這種設備以成比例或連續方式進行工作，例如用於說明模擬放大器的工作特性不是離散的或數字的，而是模擬的。
sentence.english: Pertaining to a device that operates in a proportional or continuous manner, such as an analog amplifier. Not discrete or digital, but analog.

sentence.chinese: 細部某項作品(例如繪畫、建築、裝飾)的一部分，尤指這些部分被分開來獨立考慮的部分
sentence.english: A discrete part or portion of a work, such as a painting, building, or decorative object, especially when considered in isolation.

word.chinese: [名詞] 謹慎;處理權;判斷力

sentence.chinese: 我完全相信他的判斷。
sentence.english: I trust his discretion absolutely.

sentence.chinese: 我不告訴你什麼時候離開，你已經長大了，該自己作出決定。
sentence.english: I won't tell you what time to leave, you're old enough to use your own discretion.

sentence.chinese: 死亡對每個人都一視同仁，它會降臨到每個人的身上。
sentence.english: Death does not discriminate; it comes to everyone.

sentence.chinese: 你能區別好書與壞書嗎？
sentence.english: Can you discriminate good books from bad?

sentence.chinese: 他極端反對種族歧視。
sentence.english: He is passionately opposed to racial discrimination.

sentence.chinese: 歧視黑人仍是普遍現象。
sentence.english: Discrimination against Blacks is still common.

sentence.chinese: 我們將在會議上討論這項提議。
sentence.english: We will discuss the proposal at the meeting.

sentence.chinese: 這本書講了什麼？
sentence.english: What does the book discuss?

sentence.chinese: 整個討論內容均以此為中心。
sentence.english: The whole discussion pivots on this one point.

sentence.chinese: 在他們的爭論中，我支持李先生。
sentence.english: In their discussion, I was in favor of Mr. Li.

sentence.chinese: 這種疾病的迅速蔓延使醫療當局感到憂慮不安。
sentence.english: The rapid spread of the disease is alarming the medical authorities.

sentence.chinese: 治療抑制了病情的發展。
sentence.english: The treatment arrested the growth of the disease.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使丟臉; [名詞] 恥辱;丟臉的事(或人)

sentence.chinese: 他因受賄而不光彩地辭職了。
sentence.english: He quit in disgrace over the bribe.

sentence.chinese: 他的朋友都看不起他。
sentence.english: He fell into disgrace with his companions.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 不名譽的;可恥的

sentence.chinese: “彼得，你簡直可恥。“貝蒂插嘴說。
sentence.english: 「It 's simply disgraceful of you Peter,」 threw in Betty.

sentence.chinese: 醜行，無恥行為恥辱的，不光彩的活動、行為或性格
sentence.english: Shameful or disgraceful action, conduct, or character.

word.chinese: [動詞] 掩飾,隱瞞; [名詞] 假扮,偽裝

sentence.chinese: 她對他的錯誤忍俊不禁。
sentence.english: She could not disguise her amusement at his mistake.

sentence.chinese: 那個眾人眼中的乞丐，其實是化了裝的警察。
sentence.english: The supposed beggar was really a police officer in disguise.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使作嘔; [名詞] 厭惡,憎惡

sentence.chinese: 她厭惡地轉過臉去。
sentence.english: She turned away in disgust.

sentence.chinese: 她對他的行為充滿了厭惡。
sentence.english: His behavior filled her with disgust.

sentence.chinese: 那隻盤子太淺了，不能盛湯。
sentence.english: That dish is too shallow to serve soup in.

sentence.chinese: 那個粗心的侍者把盤子摔到了地上。
sentence.english: The careless waiter dropped the dish onto the ground.

sentence.chinese: 那是個騙局，我幸而置身事外。
sentence.english: It's a dishonest scheme and I'm glad to be out of it.

sentence.chinese: 我寧可安於貧窮，也不願用不當手段賺錢。
sentence.english: I would rather remain poor than get money by dishonest means.

sentence.chinese: 這個聯盟會很快瓦解，除非採取措施加強它的團結。
sentence.english: The alliance will soon disintegrate unless something is done to pull it together.

sentence.chinese: 飛機衝向一座山，撞得粉碎。
sentence.english: The plane flew into a mountain and disintegrated on impact.

sentence.chinese: 我沒有一張唱片能引起你的興趣。
sentence.english: I have no disk that may interest you.

sentence.chinese: 計算機軟盤裝在密封的盒裡寄出。
sentence.english: The computer disk is sent in a sealed container.

word.chinese: [動詞] 不喜愛,厭惡; [名詞] 不喜愛,厭惡

sentence.chinese: 我一見他就不喜歡。
sentence.english: I took an instant dislike to him.

sentence.chinese: 我十分厭惡她強加於我的那些偏激觀念。
sentence.english: I do dislike having her extremist ideas rammed down my throat.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使驚慌;使沮喪; [名詞] 驚慌;沮喪

sentence.chinese: 她臉上流露出驚慌的神色
sentence.english: Her face registered dismay.

sentence.chinese: 這一委任使人欣慰、 悵惘等。
sentence.english: This appointment was greeted with relief, dismay, etc.

word.chinese: [動詞] 解散,遣散;解雇;開除

sentence.chinese: 老闆威脅說要解僱他，但這不過是恐嚇而已。
sentence.english: The boss threatened to dismiss him from his job, but it's all a bluff.

sentence.chinese: 起初她威脅要解僱我們所有的人，但是後來她態度軟化了。
sentence.english: At first she threatened to dismiss us all, but later she relented.

sentence.chinese: 我剛聽到他遭解僱的事。
sentence.english: I've only just heard about his dismissal.

sentence.chinese: 部長被解職的消息令很多人感到驚訝。
sentence.english: There were a lot of eyebrows raised at the news of minister's dismissal.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使混亂;擾亂; [名詞] 混亂,無秩序; 不適,小病

sentence.chinese: 屋裡杯盤狼藉。
sentence.english: Wine cups and dishes lay about in disorder in the room.

sentence.chinese: 會議在混亂中結束。
sentence.english: The meeting terminated in disorder.

word.chinese: [動詞] 派遣;發送; [名詞] 派遣;發送

sentence.chinese: 有了計算機我們可以火速地處理許多問題。
sentence.english: With computers we can solve all problems with dispatch.

sentence.chinese: 貨物發出[貨物發出時]請通知我們。
sentence.english: Please advise us of the dispatch of the goods/when the goods are dispatched.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 非必要的;可分配的

sentence.chinese: 非必要的或非重要的; 非必需的
sentence.english: Not necessary or important; dispensable.

sentence.chinese: 個人財產中不必要的項目
sentence.english: Dispensable items of personal property.

sentence.chinese: 我們只好放棄汽車。
sentence.english: We'll have to dispense with a car.

sentence.chinese: 她不能沒有傭人。
sentence.english: She cannot dispense with a servant.

sentence.chinese: 人群紛紛散開。
sentence.english: The crowd dispersed.

sentence.chinese: 風吹散了天上的雲。
sentence.english: The wind dispersed the cloud from the sky.

word.chinese: [動詞] 迫使離開;取代;免職

sentence.chinese: 在委員會中，穩健派人士取代了激進派人士。
sentence.english: Moderates have displaced the extremists on the committee.

sentence.chinese: 雜草越來越多，有取代其他植物之勢。
sentence.english: Weeds tend to displace other plants.

word.chinese: [動詞] 陳列;展出; [名詞] 展覽,陳列

sentence.chinese: 有這麼多的豪華汽車在此展出，我不知要買哪一輛才好。
sentence.english: There are so many fancy cars on display here that I don't know which to buy.

sentence.chinese: 慶祝會的高潮是燃放煙火。
sentence.english: The climax of the celebration was a firework display.

sentence.chinese: 那些話一出口我就懊悔不已，因為我知道那些話會使他不高興的。
sentence.english: No sooner had I uttered the words than I could have kicked myself, for I knew they would displease him.

sentence.chinese: 她丈夫沒注意到她的新髮型，這使她大為不快。
sentence.english: Her husband's failure to notice her new hairstyle displeased her very much.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 可任意處理的;用完即丟棄的; [名詞] 用完即丟棄的物品(如紙尿布)

sentence.chinese: 免洗尿布; 一次性剃刀
sentence.english: Disposable diapers; disposable razors.

sentence.chinese: 每一種可用的設備都被大火燒燬了
sentence.english: Every disposable piece of equipment was sent to the fire.

sentence.chinese: 有太多事要他處理，使他不能早點回家。
sentence.english: He has too many things at his disposal to go home early.

sentence.chinese: 這錢由我們自由支配使用。
sentence.english: The money is at our own disposal.

sentence.chinese: 我必須擺脫麻煩。
sentence.english: I must dispose of the trouble.

sentence.chinese: 他的工作不僅要處理難題而且也要應付突來的挑戰。
sentence.english: His job is not only to dispose of problems but (also) to meet unexpected challenges.

word.chinese: [名詞] 性情;傾向;配置;處理

sentence.chinese: 喬安娜性格溫柔而靦腆。
sentence.english: Joanna had a gentle retiring disposition.

sentence.chinese: 溫和的性情是做妻子的可取之處嗎？
sentence.english: Is a sweet disposition a recommendation in a wife?

word.chinese: [動詞] 爭論;爭執; [名詞] 爭論;爭執;爭端

sentence.chinese: 他的誠實是無可爭議的。
sentence.english: His honesty is beyond dispute.

sentence.chinese: 他們正在激烈爭論這個事件的是非曲直。
sentence.english: They are disputing about the rights and wrongs of the case.

word.chinese: [動詞] 漠視; [名詞] 漠視

sentence.chinese: 他對別人的感情漠不關心。
sentence.english: He shows ruthless disregard for other people's feelings.

sentence.chinese: 這個官員對窮人的需求表現出完全漠視的態度。
sentence.english: The official has shown a total disregard for the needs of the poor.

sentence.chinese: 一次交通事故使進出這座城市的鐵路交通陷於混亂。
sentence.english: An accident has disrupted railway services into and out of the city.

sentence.chinese: 他的講演使會場陷入混亂。
sentence.english: His speech disrupted the meeting.

sentence.chinese: 不愉快，不滿意不高興的情況或事實; 不滿
sentence.english: The condition or fact of being displeased; dissatisfaction.

sentence.chinese: 下議院議員道出了公眾對增加稅收的不滿。
sentence.english: Private members voice public dissatisfaction at have to pay higher taxes.

word.chinese: [動詞] 持異議; [名詞] 異議

sentence.chinese: 現在提出異議太晚了。
sentence.english: It is too late to make any dissent.

sentence.chinese: 我不同意這個決定。
sentence.english: We dissented from the decision.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 意見不同的; [名詞] 不贊成者;持不同政見者

sentence.chinese: 當局譴責那位持不同政見的作家是國家的敵人，並且將他軟禁起來，使他受苦受難。
sentence.english: The authorities put the dissident author through the hoop by denouncing him as an enemy of the state and putting him under house arrest.

sentence.chinese: 校園內的持不同意見者
sentence.english: The dissident element on campus.

sentence.chinese: 太陽驅散了霧。
sentence.english: The sun dissipated the mist.

sentence.chinese: 他很快就把財產浪費光了。
sentence.english: He soon dissipated his fortune.

sentence.chinese: 冰在溫暖的天氣中溶化了。
sentence.english: Ice dissolved in the warm weather.

sentence.chinese: 議會解散了。
sentence.english: The parliament was dissolved.

sentence.chinese: 老師勸我不要接受這份工作。
sentence.english: My teacher dissuade me from accepting the job.

sentence.chinese: 她試著勸兒子不要與那女孩結婚。
sentence.english: She tried to dissuade her son from marrying the girl.

sentence.chinese: 他態度冷淡是因為他勢利眼呢，還是因為他靦腆？
sentence.english: Is his distance a result of snobbery or shyness?

sentence.chinese: 我們可以望見遠處有架風車。
sentence.english: We can see a windmill in the distance.

sentence.chinese: 我們可以聽到遠處傳來的車輛往來的嗡嗡聲。
sentence.english: We could hear the distant drone of the traffic.

sentence.chinese: 在那個遙遠的小村落裡整年下雪。
sentence.english: It snows all the year round in that distant little village.

sentence.chinese: 郎姆酒是用甘蔗汁蒸餾製成的。
sentence.english: Rum is an alcoholic drink distilled from sugar-cane juice.

sentence.chinese: 你可以通過蒸餾來淨化水。
sentence.english: You can purify the water by distilling.

sentence.chinese: 這兩種觀點截然不同。
sentence.english: Those two ideas are quite distinct from each other.

sentence.chinese: 她下學期當你們的老師的可能性非常大。
sentence.english: There is a distinct posibility that she'll be your teacher next term.

sentence.chinese: 我們應該分清是非。
sentence.english: We should make a distinction between right and wrong.

sentence.chinese: 他以優異成績通過考試。
sentence.english: He passed the examination with distinction.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 有特色的;特殊的

sentence.chinese: 藝術處理一個表演者對一首歌、舞蹈、一曲音樂或角色的有特色的、個人的獨到處理; 藝術加工
sentence.english: A performer's distinctive personal version of a song, dance, piece of music, or role; a rendering.

sentence.chinese: 制服一套有特色的衣服，以將穿它的人作為特定人群的成員進行識別
sentence.english: A distinctive outfit intended to identify those who wear it as members of a specific group.

sentence.chinese: 人類和動物的區別在於人會說話。
sentence.english: Speeches distinguish human beings from animals.

sentence.chinese: 她因頭腦冷靜、敢作敢為而為人稱道。
sentence.english: She distinguished herself by her coolness and bravery.

sentence.chinese: 這位科學家在許多知識領域中都是傑出的。
sentence.english: The scientist is distinguished in many spheres of knowledge.

sentence.chinese: 女王將爵士頭銜授予幾位傑出人士。
sentence.english: The Queen conferred knighthood on several distinguished men.

sentence.chinese: 他怎麼敢如此肆無忌憚地歪曲事實！
sentence.english: How dare he distort the facts so brazenly!

sentence.chinese: 政府因為有計畫地歪曲抗議者的觀點而受到責難。
sentence.english: The government was accused of having systematically distorted the protester's case.

sentence.chinese: 那純粹是障眼法，用以分散人們對他真正意圖的注意力。
sentence.english: It was all a ploy to distract attention from his real aims.

sentence.chinese: 兒童的注意力很不容易集中。
sentence.english: Children are so easily distracted.

sentence.chinese: 辛苦一天之後，看電視有時是很美的逍遣。
sentence.english: TV can be a welcome distraction after a hard day's work.

sentence.chinese: 那孩子不斷的哭聲弄得我幾乎要發狂。
sentence.english: The child's continual crying drove me to distraction.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使悲痛;使苦惱; [名詞] 悲痛;苦惱

sentence.chinese: 他們發出了一枚呼救信號火箭。
sentence.english: They sent a distress rocket.

sentence.chinese: 他的放蕩的行為使他的母親極為苦惱。
sentence.english: His wild behavior was a great distress to his mother.

sentence.chinese: 有些植物分佈得很廣。
sentence.english: Some types of plants are widely distributed.

sentence.chinese: 圖書館裡的藏書按科目分類。
sentence.english: The books in the library were distributed according to subjects.

sentence.chinese: 在合作社中，利潤是在全體勞動者中進行分配的。
sentence.english: In a co-operative profits are distributed among the work-force.

sentence.chinese: 飛機載運的行李應均勻放置在各個部位。
sentence.english: Baggage loaded onto an aircraft must be evenly distributed.

sentence.chinese: 經理把工作儘量平均分配給僱員。
sentence.english: The manager tried to even out the distribution of work among his employees.

sentence.chinese: 炮彈的散佈範圍榴霰彈片、炮彈碎片或短槍射擊在靶區的分佈和散佈面
sentence.english: The distribution and spread, around a targeted region, of spent shrapnel, bomb fragments, or shot from a shotgun.

sentence.chinese: 您發來的樣貨得到了經銷商們的讚許。
sentence.english: The distributor look with favor on your sample shipment.

sentence.chinese: 版權授予文學、音樂、戲劇或藝術作品的作者、作曲者、劇作者、出版商或獨家經營出版、生產或銷售的批發商的合法權利
sentence.english: The legal right granted to an author, a composer, a playwright, a publisher, or a distributor to exclusive publication, production, sale, or distribution of a literary, musical, dramatic, or artistic work.

sentence.chinese: 原先普遍存在著對那一地區生活的成見越來越站不住腳了。
sentence.english: Common preconceptions about life in this district are increasingly being challenged.

sentence.chinese: 那個好心的大教主負責我們這個教區。
sentence.english: That kind archbishop is responsible for our church district.

word.chinese: [動詞] 不信任;懷疑; [名詞] 不信任;懷疑

sentence.chinese: 她總撤謊，我完全不相信她的話了。
sentence.english: Her constant lying led me to distrust everything she said.

sentence.chinese: 人家對她總是不信任。
sentence.english: She was always looked on with distrust.

sentence.chinese: 我本不想打攪你。
sentence.english: I didn't like (ie felt reluctant) to disturb you.

sentence.chinese: 在戰爭前那些美好的歲月裡，似乎沒有任何東西能打破我們平靜的生活進程。
sentence.english: It seemed nothing could disturb the even tenor of our existence in those happy prewar days.

sentence.chinese: 警察奉命出動以平息一場小規模的騷亂。
sentence.english: The police have been called in to quell a minor disturbance.

sentence.chinese: 那些人因製造騷亂被警方控訴。
sentence.english: Those men were charged by the police with causing a disturbance.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 心亂的;心理不正常的

sentence.chinese: 入夜時分，萬籟俱寂。
sentence.english: No sound disturbed the silence of the evening.

sentence.chinese: 他不把電話聽筒掛上，以免受到打擾。
sentence.english: He left the phone off the hook so that he wouldn't be disturbed.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 擾亂的;讓人擔心的

sentence.chinese: 演出進行的時候，我最不喜歡打擾別人。
sentence.english: I hate disturbing people while the show is going on.

sentence.chinese: 他有過一些使他很不安的經歷。
sentence.english: He has had some disturbing experience.

word.chinese: [動詞] 掘溝; [名詞] 溝;壕溝

sentence.chinese: 侵略者把俘虜的四肢砍掉,然後把殘缺不全的軀體扔進溝裡。
sentence.english: The invaders cut off their prisoners' arms and legs and threw their mutilated bodies into the ditch.

sentence.chinese: 汽車駛離道路跌進溝中。
sentence.english: The car ran off the road into a ditch.

word.chinese: [動詞] 跳水; [名詞] 俯衝,急劇下降

sentence.chinese: 跳水時手臂迅速前伸。
sentence.english: Throw your arms out in front of you as you dive.

sentence.chinese: 多麼優美的跳水！
sentence.english: What a beautiful dive!

word.chinese: [形容詞] 互異的;多變化的

sentence.chinese: 多方面的與不同的主題或方面有關的
sentence.english: Concerned with diverse subjects or aspects.

sentence.chinese: 他們是些有著不同文化背景的人。
sentence.english: They are the people from diverse cultures.

sentence.chinese: 一個工廠要獲得進一步發展就要努力使產品多樣化。
sentence.english: A factory must try to diversify for further development.

sentence.chinese: 山陵和樹林點綴景色。
sentence.english: Hill and woods diversify the landscape.

word.chinese: [名詞] 轉向;轉移;分散注意力

sentence.chinese: 一名匪徒在街上製造事端引人注目，其餘匪徒則搶劫銀行。
sentence.english: One of the gang created a diversion in the street while the others robbed the bank.

sentence.chinese: 象棋是他最喜歡的娛樂活動。
sentence.english: Chess is his favorite diversion.

sentence.chinese: 清新的微風在吹拂，翻過一頁，故事展開了——今天，開始了一個新篇章：是以團結、多樣化和寬宏為主題的短小而輝煌的篇章，——我們大家都參與並共同書寫。
sentence.english: The new breeze blows, a page turns, the story unfolds---and so today a chapter begins: a small and stately story of unity, diversity, and generosity---shared, and written, together.

sentence.chinese: 窮則變，變則通。
sentence.english: A diversity lead to prosperity.

sentence.chinese: 一陣喧鬧聲轉移了我們的注意力。
sentence.english: A loud noise diverted my attention.

sentence.chinese: 他們使河流改道以便向城市供水。
sentence.english: They diverted the river to supply water to the town.

sentence.chinese: 整個班級意見有分歧。
sentence.english: The class is divided in opinion.

sentence.chinese: 六除以二得三。
sentence.english: Six divided by two is three.

sentence.chinese: 我拿出一迭用橡皮筋紮緊的股息單，記在這迭單子上的數字原本會使一個經紀人非常開心的。
sentence.english: I took out a tight wad of dividend warrants ringed with a rubber band, and the records in the wad would have gladdened the heart of a broker.

sentence.chinese: 被除數被另一個數除的表達式; 被除數
sentence.english: An expression to be divided by another; a dividend.

sentence.chinese: 那頓飯簡直好極了。
sentence.english: That meal was simply divine!

sentence.chinese: 我終於看穿了事情的真相。
sentence.english: At last I divined the truth.

sentence.chinese: 加法和除法都是計算方法。

sentence.chinese: 即使一路走著去，我也得趕到那裡。
sentence.english: Even if I have to walk all the way I'll get there.

sentence.chinese: 儘管她有時很惱人，但我還是喜歡她。
sentence.english: I like her even though she can be annoying.

sentence.chinese: 傍晚天空的顏色是一片火紅和橘黃相間。
sentence.english: The evening sky flamed with red and orange.

sentence.chinese: 今天晚上你能早回家嗎？
sentence.english: Could you come back home early this evening?

sentence.chinese: 不管怎樣，她大不了就是說個『不′字。
sentence.english: In any event, the worst that she can do is say no'.

sentence.chinese: 這篇文章討論了導致她自殺的一系列事件。
sentence.english: This article discussed the events that led to her suicide.

sentence.chinese: 銷售方面的初級職位。最終目標：銷售部門的經理。
sentence.english: An entry-level position in sales. Eventual goal; manager of marketing department.

sentence.chinese: 我堅信我們最後會勝利。
sentence.english: I fervently believe in our eventual victory.

sentence.chinese: 她終於嫁給了最執著追求她的人。
sentence.english: She eventually married the most persistent one of her admirers.

sentence.chinese: 她扮演了20多年的一個角色，最後(從連續劇中)去掉了。
sentence.english: After playing the part for over 20 years, she was eventually written out (of the series).

sentence.chinese: 他接到那封信後，比以往任何時候都更加憎恨她。
sentence.english: He hated her more than ever, when he got that letter.

sentence.chinese: 那確實是一頓豐盛的飯。
sentence.english: That was a fine meal if ever there was one!

word.chinese: [形容詞] 常綠的;常青的; [名詞] 常綠樹;萬年青

sentence.chinese: 杜松子是一種生有紫紅色漿果的常綠灌木。
sentence.english: The juniper is a type of evergreen bush with purple berries.

sentence.chinese: 石南花是種常綠植物。
sentence.english: Heather is an evergreen plant.

sentence.chinese: 除了我以外，其他姑娘都穿著牛仔褲。
sentence.english: Every other girl except me is wearing jeans.

sentence.chinese: 我掙的每一便士都是辛苦工作得來的。
sentence.english: I have had to work for every single penny I earned.

sentence.chinese: 別再在大夥跟前賣弄了。
sentence.english: Stop showing off in front of everybody.

sentence.chinese: 我今天需要他－－我們需要人人都到齊。
sentence.english: I can't spare him today we need everybody here.

sentence.chinese: 每天都做同樣工作是很單調的。
sentence.english: It is very dreary to do the same job everyday.

sentence.chinese: 不經心的報紙讀者不會喜歡每天都有政論文章。
sentence.english: A casual newspaper reader wouldn't like articles on politics everyday.

word.chinese: [代名詞] 每樣事物;重於一切

sentence.chinese: 你可從售出的每種貨物中得到10%佣金。
sentence.english: You get (a) 10% commission on everything you sell.

sentence.chinese: 感謝你做的一切。
sentence.english: Thank you for everything.

sentence.chinese: 這個老人隨時都帶著他的半導體收音機。
sentence.english: The old man took her transistor everywhere with him.

sentence.chinese: 總統葬禮那天，全國到處降半旗致哀。
sentence.english: Flags were at half mast everywhere on the day of the president's funeral.

word.chinese: [動詞] 顯示,表明; [名詞] 證據;證詞;證人;物證

sentence.chinese: 從西班牙隊最近的比賽情況來看，他們難以在這一錦標賽中奪標。
sentence.english: On the evidence of their recent matches it's unlikely the Spanish team will win the cup.

sentence.chinese: 沒有充分的證據能證明他有罪。
sentence.english: There wasn't enough evidence to prove his guilt.

sentence.chinese: 這種目的不一定顯而易見。
sentence.english: The purpose may not be immediately evident.

sentence.chinese: 顯然這項政策是失敗的。
sentence.english: It was evident that the policy was a failure.

sentence.chinese: 這位房東顯然認為他的責任只不過是收房租而已。我們看過的每一個住宅的情況也證實了這種失職的態度。
sentence.english: The owner evidently thought his duties ended with collecting the rents and every dwelling we visited told the same story of neglect.

sentence.chinese: 很明顯船主應承擔此費用。
sentence.english: Evidently shipowner to bear expense refer.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 邪惡的; [名詞] 邪惡,罪惡

sentence.chinese: 用魔鬼象徵罪惡是中世紀繪畫的特色。
sentence.english: The personification of evil as a devil is a feature of medieval painting.

sentence.chinese: 天宮圖上的動物沒有一種被認為是愚笨的或醜陋的或邪惡的。
sentence.english: No animal of the horoscope is considered dumb or ugly or evil.

sentence.chinese: 喚起往日回憶的歌曲
sentence.english: Songs that evoke old memories.

sentence.chinese: 陳腐的，老一套的因久用或重複而失去引起興趣的力量的，老生常談的
sentence.english: Lacking power to evoke interest through overuse or repetition; hackneyed.

sentence.chinese: 我們的口號是: 『要循序漸進，不要劇烈變革.′
sentence.english: Our watchword is: Evolution, not revolution'.

sentence.chinese: 我們的政治制度正在不斷發展中。
sentence.english: Our political institutions are in continuous evolution.

sentence.chinese: 他經過多年的研究，逐漸總結出了新的理論。
sentence.english: He has evolved a new theory after many years of research.

sentence.chinese: 美國憲法是精心制定的，英國憲法是約定俗成的。
sentence.english: The American constitution was planned; the British constitution evolved.

sentence.chinese: 告訴我下一班火車抵達的正確時刻。
sentence.english: Tell me (the exact time) when the next train will arrive.

sentence.chinese: 我不知道確切的日子。
sentence.english: I don't know the exact date.

word.chinese: [副詞] 確切地,精確地;完全地

sentence.chinese: 火車八點鐘準時到達。
sentence.english: The train arrived at exactly 8 o'clock.

sentence.chinese: 他們的回答完全一樣。
sentence.english: Their answers are exactly the same.

word.chinese: [動詞] 張,誇大;對...言過其實

sentence.chinese: 不要誇大那兩件事的相似性。
sentence.english: Don't exaggerate the parallelism between the two cases.

sentence.chinese: 他自視過高。
sentence.english: He has an exaggerated idea of his own importance.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 誇張的;言過其實的

sentence.chinese: 新聞報導肆意誇大了整個事件。
sentence.english: The press exaggerated the whole affair wildly.

sentence.chinese: 報告被嚴重誇大了。
sentence.english: The reports were greatly exaggerated.

sentence.chinese: 被選擇出來的事實、誇張以及戰時宣傳的謊言
sentence.english: The selected truths, exaggerations, and lies of wartime propaganda.

sentence.chinese: 我可以毫不誇張地說她是個天使。
sentence.english: I can say without exaggeration that she is an angel.

sentence.chinese: 他考了多次都不及格。
sentence.english: He repeatedly fails to pass the exam.

sentence.chinese: 想到還需重新考試，我就感到沮喪。
sentence.english: The thought of having to take the exam again depressed me.

sentence.chinese: 我除了要通過考試之外，沒有別的心願。
sentence.english: I have no other wish except to pass the examination.

sentence.chinese: 醫生給他做了檢查，看他是否有肺病。
sentence.english: The doctor gave him an examination to see if he had chest trouble.

sentence.chinese: 派來調查的警察說，我家的大門是根據極其合乎科學的原理給撬開來的。
sentence.english: The policeman who is sent down to examine, says my house has been broken open on the most scientific principle.

sentence.chinese: 他們在他床的四周放上屏風，以便醫生給他檢查。
sentence.english: They put a screen around his bed so that the doctor could examine him.

sentence.chinese: 應考者有十名不及格。
sentence.english: Ten of the examinees were failed.
名詞 examinee:

word.chinese: [名詞] 主考人;檢查人;審查員

sentence.chinese: 我開車的技術糟透了，但考官讓我及格了。
sentence.english: I'm a hopeless driver, but the examiner let me through.

sentence.chinese: 在檢察員警惕的目光下，我害怕了。
sentence.english: I am afraid under the vigilant eyes of the examiner.

sentence.chinese: 這對設計新市中心是個最佳的反面教材。
sentence.english: It is a classic example of how not to design a new city centre.

sentence.chinese: 許多偉人從貧困中崛起，例如林肯。
sentence.english: Many great men have risen from poverty---Lincoln, for example.

sentence.chinese: 不要超過規定的劑量。
sentence.english: Do not exceed the recommended dosage.

sentence.chinese: 如果你所負的債超過你的資產，你就會破產。
sentence.english: If your liabilities exceed your assets, you may go bankrupt.

sentence.chinese: 由於海關徵收繁重的緊急關稅，使得我們處於極其困難的境地。
sentence.english: The imposition of heavy emergency custom duties have render our position exceedingly difficult.

sentence.chinese: 他是一個非常令人生厭的傢伙。
sentence.english: He is an exceedingly tedious fellow.

sentence.chinese: 他們在各自領域裡都是出類拔萃的。
sentence.english: They each excel in their respective fields.

sentence.chinese: 他的妻子在戰略上勝過他。
sentence.english: His wife excels him in strategical ability.

sentence.chinese: 這家商號是優質的保證。
sentence.english: The firm is a byword for excellence.

sentence.chinese: 卓越的，傑出的以卓越或傑出為特點的; 卓著的
sentence.english: Characterized by excellence or distinction; eminent.

sentence.chinese: 這座大廳可當作極好的劇院。
sentence.english: This hall would make an excellent theatre.

sentence.chinese: 這本雜誌登載優秀的小說。
sentence.english: This magazine published excellent stories.

word.chinese: [介係詞] 除 ...... 之外; [連接詞] 除了;要不是;但是

sentence.chinese: 除我之外，他們都去睡覺了。
sentence.english: They all went to sleep except me.

sentence.chinese: 我沒有邀請詹姆斯。
sentence.english: I excepted James from my invitation.

sentence.chinese: 所有的學生毫無例外，都必須參加英語考試。

sentence.chinese: 任何規律總有例外。
sentence.english: There is always an exception to any rule.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 例外的;異常的;特殊的

sentence.chinese: 特殊項目記在公司帳目的橫線之上。
sentence.english: Exceptional item is noted above the line in company account.

sentence.chinese: 植樹造林以罕見的速度得到了發展。
sentence.english: Forestry has advanced with exceptional speed.

word.chinese: [動詞] 摘錄;引用; [名詞] 摘錄;引用

sentence.chinese: 連鎖系列緊密相接的系列，尤指節錄作品或評論
sentence.english: A closely linked series, especially of excerpted writings or commentaries.

sentence.chinese: 使徒書信節選從使徒書信中選取的，作為宗教儀式或活動的一部分來誦讀的一段
sentence.english: An excerpt from one of these letters, read as part of a religious service.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 過量的;額外的; [名詞] 超越;過量

sentence.chinese: 盡人皆知他在聚會上十分放肆。
sentence.english: His excesses at parties are well known.

sentence.chinese: 高利貸是指超過法定利率取息。
sentence.english: Usury is interest in excess of a legal rate.

sentence.chinese: 愛國主義過了頭即可導致仇視一切外國人。
sentence.english: Excessive patriotism can lead to xenophobia.

sentence.chinese: 這種藥使用過量會損害肝臟。
sentence.english: Excessive dosage of this drug can result in injury to the liver.

word.chinese: [動詞] 交換;調換;兌換; [名詞] 交換;交流;交易所

sentence.chinese: 在會上，我們就此事交換了意見。
sentence.english: We exchanged our opinions about the event at the meeting.

sentence.chinese: 他給我一個蘋果，交換一個橙子。
sentence.english: He gave me an apple in exchange of an orange.

sentence.chinese: 有的人看到色情雜誌能激發起性慾。
sentence.english: Some people are sexually excited by pornographic magazines.

sentence.chinese: 你的話引起了他的嫉妒。
sentence.english: Your remark excited him to jealousy.

sentence.chinese: 莎拉看到搖滾樂團很興奮。
sentence.english: Sara was excited to see the rock band.

sentence.chinese: 哦，我太興奮了。
sentence.english: Oh, I'm so excited.

sentence.chinese: 我興致勃勃地做好去度假的準備，可是現在吹了。
sentence.english: I was all geared up (ie excitedly ready) to go on holiday, and now it's been cancelled.

sentence.chinese: 那條狗興奮地直搖尾巴。
sentence.english: The dog wagged its tail excitedly.

sentence.chinese: 激動使我的心跳加快。
sentence.english: The excitement quickened my pulse.

sentence.chinese: 他感到很興奮。
sentence.english: He was tingling with excitement.

sentence.chinese: 有點剌激。
sentence.english: It was kind of exciting.

sentence.chinese: 這非常激動人心。
sentence.english: It's very exciting.

sentence.chinese: 她對這美麗的景色感到驚奇。
sentence.english: She exclaimed at the beautiful view.

sentence.chinese: 報紙指責政府的行動。
sentence.english: The newspapers exclaimed against the government's action.

word.chinese: [動詞] 拒絕接納;排除在外

sentence.chinese: 人人都得站崗放哨。
sentence.english: No one was excluded from sentry duty.

sentence.chinese: 我們不能排除他殺了他妻子的可能性。
sentence.english: We cannot exclude the possibility that he killed his wife.

sentence.chinese: 湯姆因被逐出委員會而很生氣。
sentence.english: The exclusion of tom from the committee make him angry.

sentence.chinese: 他把空餘時間都用在園藝上了，沒有任何其他愛好。
sentence.english: He spends his spare time gardening, to the exclusion of all other interests.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 排外的;唯一的;獨家的; [名詞] 獨家新聞;獨家產品

sentence.chinese: 他活動於社交甚嚴的社交圈內，而且屬於那些最不願吸收外人的俱樂部。
sentence.english: He moves in exclusive social circles and belongs to the most exclusive clubs.

sentence.chinese: 他所處的社交圈子很排外，而且參加的又是個很排外的社團。
sentence.english: He is part of an exclusive social circle and belongs to an exclusive club.

sentence.chinese: 碳環的有一個僅由碳原子組成的環的，如苯
sentence.english: Having a ring composed exclusively of carbon atoms, as benzene.

sentence.chinese: 人類解釋宇宙說的完全以人類的價值標準和經驗解釋宇宙存在的
sentence.english: Interpreting reality exclusively in terms of human values and experience.

sentence.chinese: 在數字信號技術中，用正(或負)向電壓與地兩個電平來表示二進制「1」和「0」的一種信號
sentence.english: In digital signal technique, a signal that uses a positive(or negative) excursion and ground as the two binary signal states.

sentence.chinese: 我不知不覺被拉來參加了這次遠足旅行。
sentence.english: I was roped in for this excursion before I knew it.

word.chinese: [動詞] 原諒;借光; [名詞] 藉口

sentence.chinese: 勞駕，能讓我過去嗎？
sentence.english: Excuse me, can I get past, please?

sentence.chinese: 對不起，但是我必須說你完全錯了。
sentence.english: Excuse me, but I must say you are completely wrong.

sentence.chinese: 他們把國王處決了。
sentence.english: They executed the king.

sentence.chinese: 國會制定法律，總統執行法律。
sentence.english: Congress makes the laws; the President executes them.

sentence.chinese: 他所做的一切銷售計畫都是不能實現的。
sentence.english: Every selling plan made by him is impossible of execution.

sentence.chinese: 他的用意很好，但他做起來卻不令人滿意。
sentence.english: His intention was good, but his execution of the plan was unsatisfactory.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 執行的;行政部門的; [名詞] 執行者;業務主管

sentence.chinese: 比爾是執行委員會主席。
sentence.english: Bill is chairman of the executive committee.

sentence.chinese: 他似乎比較像一個軍官，而不像一個商業行政主管。
sentence.english: He seems more like a military officer than a business executive.

sentence.chinese: 最近的石油漲價是汽車工業正面臨的困難的一個例子。
sentence.english: The recent oil price rises exemplify the difficulties which the motor industry is now facing.

sentence.chinese: 這幅畫是該畫家早期藝術風格的典型。
sentence.english: This painting exemplifies the artist's early style.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 被免除的;被豁免的; [動詞] 免除;豁免

sentence.chinese: 他因年幼而獲得免費。
sentence.english: He was exempt from charges by virtue of his youth/of being so young/of the fact that he was so young.

sentence.chinese: 他免服兵役。
sentence.english: He is exempt from military service.

word.chinese: [動詞] 鍛鍊;操練;練習;運用,行使; [名詞] 運動;習題

sentence.chinese: 如果你不多作運動，就會發胖。
sentence.english: If you don't get more exercise, you'll get fat.

sentence.chinese: 別人怎樣想對我們多半會產生很大影響。
sentence.english: What others think exercises a great influence on most of us.

sentence.chinese: 他用盡一切影響力使他們接受他的計畫。
sentence.english: He exerted all his influence to make them accept his plan.

sentence.chinese: 她丈夫殷切地希望她能成功，給了她很大的壓力。
sentence.english: Her husband exerted a lot of pressure on her to succeed.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使精疲力盡; [名詞] 排出;排氣

sentence.chinese: 排氣管中射出了火星。
sentence.english: The exhaust pipe shot sparks.

sentence.chinese: 她哭不出來了，因為眼淚都已哭幹了。
sentence.english: She did not cry out; her tears were exhausted.

word.chinese: [動詞] 展示,陳列; [名詞] 展示品,陳列品

sentence.chinese: 她在攀登過程中表現出極大的耐力。
sentence.english: She exhibited great powers of endurance during the climb.

sentence.chinese: 博物館展出了許多出土文物。
sentence.english: Many unearthed cultural relics were exhibited at the museum.

sentence.chinese: 下星期將舉辦一個關於我國汽車工業發展的展覽。
sentence.english: There will be an exhibition of the development of automobile industry in our country next week.

sentence.chinese: 他們從遠處趕來參觀這個展覽會。
sentence.english: They came from afar to see the exhibition.

word.chinese: [動詞] 流放;放逐; [名詞] 流放;流亡;被流放者

sentence.chinese: 他遭流放是進了活地獄。
sentence.english: Exile was for him a living death.

sentence.chinese: 他已陷於進退維谷的地步，不是坐牢就是流放，必須在兩者間做出抉擇。
sentence.english: He was in the unenviable position of having to choose between imprisonment or exile.

sentence.chinese: 那部門已不復存在。
sentence.english: That department has ceased to exist.

sentence.chinese: 我靠我掙的工資簡直難以　口，根本無錢享受。
sentence.english: I can hardly exist on the wage I'm getting; there is no money for luxuries.

sentence.chinese: 某位哲學家認為，存在的事物都是合理的。
sentence.english: According to some philosopher, everything in existence is reasonable.

sentence.chinese: 污染對這一物種的繼續生存造成了威脅。
sentence.english: Pollution poses a threat to the continued existence of this species.

sentence.chinese: 要加入俱樂部必須有一位會員做介紹人。
sentence.english: To join the club you have to be put up by an existing member.

sentence.chinese: 這位部長在她的講話中表示不同意對現行法律作任何更改。
sentence.english: In her speech, the Minister came out against any change to the existing law.

word.chinese: [動詞] 出去,離去;退去; [名詞] 出口

sentence.chinese: 我終於獲得了出境簽證。
sentence.english: I was eventually granted an exit visa.

sentence.chinese: 她衝向出口。
sentence.english: She made a dart for the exit.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 異國情調的;外來的

sentence.chinese: 愚昧像個妖嫩奇異的水果，稍一觸摸，就會失去其清新。
sentence.english: Ignorance is like a delicate exotic fruit: touch it, and the bloom is gone.

sentence.chinese: 外國人或事物
sentence.english: One that is exotic.

sentence.chinese: 金屬遇熱則膨脹。
sentence.english: Metals expand when they are heated.

sentence.chinese: 近年來我們的對外貿易有所增加。
sentence.english: Our foreign trade has expanded during recent years.

sentence.chinese: 他的經濟政策為工業的擴展鋪平了道路。
sentence.english: His economic policies paved the way for industrial expansion.

sentence.chinese: 工廠的擴展意味著將增雇六十名工人。
sentence.english: The expansion of the factory will mean the employment of sixty extra workers.

sentence.chinese: 我預計我會在週日回來的。
sentence.english: I expect I will be back on Sunday.

word.chinese: [名詞] 專門知識;專門技術

sentence.chinese: 但是我們彼此合作的領域還在不斷增加。我們已經商定在貿易、技術、投資以及科學與管理專門知識的交流等方面更密切地合作。

sentence.english: And the scientist in Boston will be able to call on the expertise of the scientist in Shanghai, and all of it in a matter of seconds.

sentence.chinese: 在計算機安全學中，一種計算機程序，表面上或實際上有某種有用的功能，而含有附加的(隱藏的)可能利用了調用進程的合法特許來危害系統安全的功能。

sentence.english: German geophysicist, meteorologist, and explorer who proposed the theory of continental drift.

sentence.english: A young student fainted in the hot sun.

sentence.english: Now tell me the truth: I don't want any more of your fairy stories.'

sentence.chinese: 我女兒總讓我給她講童話故事。

word.chinese: [動詞] 掉下; [名詞] 秋天

word.chinese: [形容詞] 遠的; [副詞] 遠;遙遠地;久遠地

sentence.english: Feather is very light, so that we say 「as light as a feather 」.

word.chinese: [動詞] 以...為特色; [名詞] 特徵,特色

sentence.english: The personification of evil as a devil is a feature of medieval painting.

sentence.chinese: 但是制訂鼓勵人們儲蓄獎勵辦法是當務之急，官員們說他們想要尋求不致過分影響聯邦歲入的辦法，至少幾年之內不致影響。

sentence.english: Meanwhile, you are allowed to feedback your thoughts and opinions regularly to develop our program and the club.

word.chinese: [名詞] 給食者;餵食器;支線;支流

sentence.english: The little boy is a noisy feeder.
名詞 feeder:

word.chinese: [形容詞] 同事的;同類的; [名詞] 夥伴;同事

sentence.english: We've sinned against you, and against our fellow men.

sentence.chinese: 觀眾席照明燈照亮音樂廳、戲院或報告廳的觀眾席的燈
sentence.english: The lights that illuminate the audience section of a concert hall, a theater, or an auditorium.

sentence.chinese: 海市蜃樓是一種視錯覺。
sentence.english: A mirage is an optical illusion.

sentence.chinese: 我以為我看見鬼了，其實只是一種幻覺。
sentence.english: I thought I saw a ghost but it was just an optical illusion.

sentence.chinese: 他指著圖表來說明他的論點。
sentence.english: He pointed at the diagram to illustrate his point.

sentence.chinese: 我們的課本插圖豐富。
sentence.english: Our textbook is very well illustrated.

sentence.chinese: 本圖所示為木材的縱剖面。
sentence.english: This illustration shows a section through the timber.

sentence.chinese: 在插圖上找一找你出生的年分。
sentence.english: Find the year of your birth on the illustration.

sentence.chinese: 這家公司關心它自身的法人形象。
sentence.english: This company is concerned about its corporate image.

sentence.chinese: 她和她母親長得一模一樣。
sentence.english: She is the express image of her mother.

sentence.chinese: 對她來說，不得不離開倫敦大概是能想像到的最大的損失。
sentence.english: It would be the greatest imaginable privation for her to have to leave London.

sentence.chinese: 我們為了及時趕到此地，經歷了可能想見的最大的困難。
sentence.english: We had the greatest difficulty imaginable getting here in time.

sentence.chinese: 理想或想像的世界
sentence.english: An ideal or imaginary land.

sentence.chinese: 人們對於虛構的地獄中的鬼神仍具有一種普遍的恐懼。
sentence.english: People still have a general fear for the imaginary infernal powers.

sentence.chinese: 我看到的不可能是鬼－－一定是幻想的東西吧。
sentence.english: I can't have seen a ghost it must have been imagination.

sentence.chinese: 你並沒有真地看見鬼，這僅僅是幻象。
sentence.english: You didn't really see a ghost, it's only imagination.

sentence.chinese: 我想不出誰會關心我的所作所為。
sentence.english: I can't imagine that anyone cares what I do.

sentence.chinese: 你可以想像我是多麼驚訝。
sentence.english: You can imagine how surprised I was.

sentence.chinese: 他們看著電視裡的快步舞並且試圖模仿。
sentence.english: They watched jig on TV and tried to imitate.

sentence.chinese: 你應倣傚偉大善良的人。
sentence.english: You should imitate great and good people.

word.chinese: [名詞] 模仿,模擬;仿造;偽造

sentence.chinese: 她的天真只是一種偽裝。
sentence.english: Her innocence is only an imitation.

sentence.chinese: 花飾上釉陶器模仿這種陶器製作的陶器
sentence.english: Pottery made in imitation of this earthenware.

sentence.chinese: 她被捕的事立刻在新聞界引起反應。
sentence.english: Her arrest produced an immediate reaction from the press.

sentence.chinese: 這件工作急需你立即處理。
sentence.english: This work demands your immediate attention.

sentence.chinese: 他馬上開始尋找另一個職位。
sentence.english: He began to look for another position immediately.

sentence.chinese: 你必須立即向他道歉。
sentence.english: It's imperative that you apologize to him immediately.

sentence.chinese: 她對國家的貢獻極大。
sentence.english: Her services to the state have been immense.

sentence.chinese: 我和雅克住的房間雖大，但是一張巨大的、鋪羽毛褥墊的床卻使它顯得窄小起來。那床巨大無比，簡直和網球場一樣大，像用一捆捆乾草墊起來似地那般厚實。
sentence.english: The room Jacques and I occupied, though large, was dwarfed by an immense feather bed. It was a bed to end all beds, almost as big as a tennis court and as thick as a bale of hay.

sentence.chinese: 把那棵植物在水裡浸泡幾分鐘。
sentence.english: Please immerse the plant in water for a few minutes.

sentence.chinese: 他埋頭於工作。
sentence.english: He immersed himself totally in his work.

sentence.chinese: 移民來的工人已歸入外僑類。
sentence.english: Immigrant workers were classed as resident aliens.

sentence.chinese: 他承認他是非法移民。
sentence.english: He admitted that he was an illegal immigrant.

sentence.chinese: 我的家人和我打算明年移民到美國，我有很多問題，你能幫我忙嗎？
sentence.english: My family and I are planning to immigrate to America next year. I have so many questions. Can you help me?

sentence.chinese: 許多國家的人移居到美國和加拿大。
sentence.english: People from many countries immigrated to the United States and Canada.

sentence.chinese: 下院議員正在施加壓力使移民法得以廢止。
sentence.english: Mps are pressing for the repeal of the immigration act.

sentence.chinese: 移民局的官員將要求你出示證件。
sentence.english: Immigration officials will ask to see your papers.

word.chinese: [形容詞] (危險等)逼近的;即將發生的

sentence.chinese: 那條船馬上就有失事的危險。
sentence.english: The ship was in imminent peril of being wrecked.

sentence.chinese: 瓦薩裡，喬吉奧1511－1574意大利畫家、建築師和藝術歷史學家，他創作了最迫近的意大利建築師、畫家和雕塑家的生活(1550年), 這是一部關於文藝復興藝術的歷史
sentence.english: Italian painter, architect, and art historian who wrote Lives of the Most Imminent Italian Architects, Painters, and Sculptors(1550), a history of Renaissance art.

sentence.chinese: 免除，免疫免疫的狀態或性質
sentence.english: The quality or condition of being immune.

sentence.chinese: 這個罪犯被告知，如果他協助警方就可以免於被起訴。
sentence.english: The criminal was told he would be immune if he helped the police.

word.chinese: [動詞] 壓緊;擠滿; [名詞] 衝擊,撞擊;影響

sentence.chinese: 這些子彈射中物體時爆炸成碎片。
sentence.english: These bullets fragment on impact.

sentence.chinese: 飛機衝向一座山，撞得粉碎。
sentence.english: The plane flew into a mountain and disintegrated on impact.

sentence.chinese: 在通信鏈路上出現的噪音或無用的信號，它損害語音、數據的接收或正確的解釋。
sentence.english: On a communications link, noise or unwanted signals that impair the receipt or correct interpretation of speech or data.

sentence.chinese: 生病降低了他的效率。
sentence.english: His illness has impaired his efficiency.

sentence.chinese: 花青素一種可溶性顏料，可以使花和其它植物部位產生顏色，其顏色變化從紫色和藍色到大多數紅色
sentence.english: Any of various water-soluble pigments that impart to flowers and other plant parts colors ranging from violet and blue to most shades of red.

sentence.chinese: 教師的作用是傳授知識。
sentence.english: A teacher's aim is to impart knowledge.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 無耐心的,不耐煩的

sentence.chinese: 他急於想知道發生了什麼事。
sentence.english: He's impatient to know what happened.

sentence.chinese: 他毫無耐性，對他來說排隊等候完全是活受罪。
sentence.english: He's so impatient that waiting in queues is sheer purgatory for him.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 必要的;命令式的;祈使法的; [名詞] 必要的事;命令;祈使語氣

sentence.chinese: 你必須立即向他道歉。
sentence.english: It's imperative that you apologize to him immediately.

sentence.chinese: 創造就業機會是政府必須做的事。
sentence.english: Job creation has become an imperative for the government.

sentence.chinese: 現在已經到了拋棄帝國歷史的幻想的時候了。
sentence.english: The time has come to abandon the romantic view of Imperial history.

sentence.chinese: 你去過故宮嗎？
sentence.english: Have you been to the Imperial Palace?

sentence.chinese: 機械的無意識的，無人性的; 機械的
sentence.english: Automatic and impersonal; mechanical.

sentence.chinese: 一個沒有人情味的大公司
sentence.english: A large, impersonal corporation.

sentence.chinese: 這次歷史性的罷工對整個美國的勞工運動起了很大的推動作用。
sentence.english: The historic strike gave an enormous impetus to the whole American labor movement.

sentence.chinese: 衝力運動中物體的動力
sentence.english: Impetus of a physical object in motion.

sentence.chinese: 強迫推行一項政策不是辦法。
sentence.english: It is not the proper way to implement a policy by force.

sentence.chinese: 他說他的計畫的優點是最簡單易行。
sentence.english: He said his plan had the virtue of being the easiest to implement.

word.chinese: [名詞] 含意;言外之意;暗示

sentence.english: The new report has far-reaching implications for the future of broadcasting.

sentence.chinese: 審訊結果表明這個組織中幾個主要人物都牽連在案。
sentence.english: The trial resulted in the implication of several major figures in the organization.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 不言明的;含蓄的

sentence.english: The system of rules implicit in a language, viewed as a mechanism for generating all sentences possible in that language.

sentence.english: Her attitude was implicit in the answer she gave us.

sentence.chinese: 我認為自由一定包含著責任。
sentence.english: I think freedom does imply responsibility.

sentence.chinese: 他沉默不語意味著同意了。

sentence.chinese: 讓他等一會兒吧,好教訓教訓他別那麼沒禮貌。
sentence.english: Let him cool his heels for a while: that'll teach him to be impolite.

sentence.chinese: 現在沒禮貌司機佔多數。
sentence.english: Nowadays impolite drivers constitute the majority of motorists.

word.chinese: [動詞] 輸入; [名詞] 進口商品

sentence.chinese: 政府對奢侈品的進口採取了嚴格的管制。

sentence.chinese: 他自視過高。

sentence.chinese: 這是所做出的最重大的發現之一。

sentence.chinese: 他們威脅說要對該國實行封鎖。

sentence.chinese: 他硬要跟我們一起過週末。

word.chinese: [形容詞] 壯觀的;氣勢宏偉的;莊嚴的

sentence.chinese: 法官判他罰款10 美元。
sentence.english: The judge imposed a fine of ten dollars on him.

sentence.chinese: 和善的夫子不待我問，就對我說：「看那個正在走來的偉大的靈魂，他彷彿一點不因痛苦而流淚：他還保持著一副怎樣堂皇的外貌啊！
sentence.english: And the good master, without my asking him, said, 「Look at that imposing one approaching, who does not shed a single tear of pain: what majesty he still maintains down there!」

sentence.chinese: 在無邊無際的海洋中要找到他幾乎是不可能的。
sentence.english: It's almost impossible to find him in the immense ocean.

sentence.chinese: 下屆選舉誰能獲勝無法預知。
sentence.english: It's impossible to tell who will win the next election.

sentence.english: I had a chance to impress her with my efficiency and I muffed it up.

sentence.english: My father impressed me with the importance of hard work.

sentence.chinese: 懲罰對這孩子似乎沒什麼效果。

sentence.chinese: 在一出極為成功的演出中，一位著名演員有一次被選派扮演一名貴族。這位貴族被關押在巴士底獄已20年了。
sentence.english: A famous actor in a highly successful play was once cast in the role of an aristocrat who had been imprisoned in the Bastille for twenty years.

sentence.chinese: 對這種重大罪行通常處以監禁。

sentence.chinese: 他已上訴請求將死刑減為無期徒刑。
sentence.english: He appealed for (a) commutation of the death sentence to life imprisonment.

sentence.chinese: 酒存放得越久越醇。

sentence.chinese: 我希望星期五之前天氣會好轉。

sentence.chinese: 這位人道主義科學家呼籲改善窮人的生活條件。

word.chinese: [形容詞] 衝動的; [名詞] 衝動;推動力

sentence.english: An emotion, desire, physiological need, or similar impulse that acts as an incitement to action.

sentence.english: Such impulsive acts as hugging strangers; impulsive generosity.

sentence.chinese: 錘子一種通過敲擊發出衝擊力的工具，包括一個把手和一個與之垂直的由較沉、較重的金屬製成的頭
sentence.english: A hand tool used to exert an impulsive force by striking, consisting of a handle with a perpendicularly attached head made of a relatively heavy, rigid material.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 在裡面的; [副詞] 進;在裡頭;在家; [介係詞] 在 ...... 之內

sentence.chinese: 我已多年沒有見到他了。
sentence.english: I haven't seen him in years.

sentence.chinese: 這場惠斯特橋牌你參加嗎？
sentence.english: Are you in for this game of whist?

sentence.chinese: 消化不良由於上述消化吸收能力欠缺或困難而引起的不適或疾病
sentence.english: Discomfort or illness resulting from this inability or difficulty.

sentence.chinese: 不孕持續的不能懷孕的能力
sentence.english: The persistent inability to conceive a child.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 達不到的;難接近的

sentence.english: A flexible fiber-optic instrument used to view an object or area, such as a body cavity, that would otherwise be inaccessible.

sentence.chinese: 那個洞穴在沒人能爬的高聳的懸崖頂上，無法進入。
sentence.english: The cave is inaccessible, high up the top of a cliff which no one can climb.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 不充分的;不適當的

sentence.english: The plan, brilliant in its conception, failed because of inadequate preparation.

sentence.chinese: 比起災區的損失，我們的支援不過杯水車薪。
sentence.english: Considering the losses in the disaster area, our support was an utterly inadequate measure.

sentence.chinese: 不合適的不恰當的或不合適的; 不合宜的
sentence.english: Not apt or fitting; inappropriate.

sentence.chinese: 輕浮，輕率舉止或言談不嚴肅，尤指在不適當的場合; 輕佻
sentence.english: Lightness of manner or speech, especially when inappropriate; frivolity.

sentence.english: Inaugurate a community center.

sentence.chinese: 克林頓就職美國總統。
sentence.english: Mr. Clinton was inaugurated as the President of the U.S.A.

word.chinese: [動詞] 激怒;敬香; [名詞] 香

sentence.chinese: 和尚在香爐裡焚上一柱香。
sentence.english: The monk burned a stick of incense in the incense burner.

sentence.chinese: 我對他的粗魯感到憤怒。
sentence.english: I was incensed at his rudeness.

sentence.english: The cash discount given on this bill is an incentive to pay the bill on date due.

sentence.english: The management wanted some250 workers to give up their present incentive pay, which would have cut their daily wages by about$5 a man.

sentence.chinese: 那輛汽車差一點兒撞著我。
sentence.english: The car missed me by inches.

sentence.english: The police examined every inch of the house for clues.

sentence.english: The rate of incidence of a disease.

sentence.english: The kidnapping caused an international incident.

sentence.chinese: 各種情況的偶然巧合導致了這件事的發生。

word.chinese: [動詞] 傾斜;屈身;有意; [名詞] 傾斜;斜面;斜坡

sentence.english: I'm inclined to tiredness in winter.

sentence.chinese: 我傾向於相信他的無辜。
sentence.english: I'm inclined to believe him innocent.

sentence.chinese: 我傾向於相信他的無辜。
sentence.english: I'm inclined to believe him innocent.

sentence.chinese: 路易絲很有音樂天賦。
sentence.english: Louise is very musically inclined.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 包含的;包括在內的

sentence.english: The monthly rent is$20 inclusive of everything.

sentence.english: Reserve double room June fourth to tenth inclusive.

sentence.english: The capital and largest city of Djibouti, in the southeast part of the country on an inlet of the Gulf of Aden. It was founded by the French in1888. Population, 120,000.

sentence.english: A borough of southern Wales west-northwest of Cardiff. It is an industrial port on Swansea Bay, an inlet of the Bristol Channel. Population, 188,500.
