word.chinese: [形容詞] 空閒的;業餘的; [名詞] 閒暇,空暇時間

sentence.chinese: 我目前的這一切額外工作用去了我的閒暇時間。
sentence.english: All this extra work I'm doing is breaking into my leisure time.

sentence.chinese: 屢次侵佔我的閒暇時間，我很反感。
sentence.english: I resent these incursions into/upon my leisure time.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 從容不迫的,悠閒的; [副詞] 從容不迫地,慢慢地

sentence.chinese: 這個旅遊團悠閒地參觀這個博物館。
sentence.english: The group tour the museum at a leisurely pace.

sentence.chinese: 什麼都不如檸檬茶那樣提神。
sentence.english: There is nothing as refreshing as lemon tea.

sentence.chinese: 瓶裝檸檬汁可不行－－你得用真貨。
sentence.english: Bottled lemon juice is no good you must use the real thing.

sentence.chinese: 你喝茶、 (還是)咖啡還是汽水?
sentence.english: Will you have tea, (or) coffee or lemonade?

sentence.chinese: 請來兩杯啤酒與汽水混合的飲料。
sentence.english: Two lemonade shandies, please.

sentence.chinese: 請把鉛筆借給我用用好嗎？
sentence.english: Would you please lend me your pencil?

sentence.chinese: 你能借給我五美元嗎？
sentence.english: Can you lend me five dollars?

sentence.chinese: 你洗澡用那麼長時間，真不像話。
sentence.english: You spend a ridiculous length of time in the bath.

sentence.chinese: 癮君子為了得到毒品什麼事都做得出來。
sentence.english: There are no lengths to which an addict will not go to obtain his drug.

sentence.chinese: 你不可以增加些例子，把發言拉長一些嗎？
sentence.english: Could you lengthen your speech out by adding some examples?

sentence.chinese: 白晝在三月裡開始變長。
sentence.english: The days started to lengthen in March.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 長的;冗長的;囉唆的

sentence.chinese: 他慣於做長篇大論的演說。
sentence.english: He was wont to give lengthy speeches.

sentence.chinese: 有關方面就我的婚姻狀況以及銀行存款餘額對我進行了詳細的調查。
sentence.english: I was subjected to a lengthy inquisition into the state of my marriage and the size of my bank balance.

sentence.chinese: 醫生在這次手術中給病人(眼球)植入了新的水晶體。
sentence.english: In this operation the surgeons implant a new lens (in the eye).

sentence.chinese: 別把鏡頭弄髒了，我剛剛擦過。
sentence.english: Don't smear the lens; I've just polished it.

sentence.chinese: [諺]江山易改，本性難移。
sentence.english: The leopard cannot change its spots.

sentence.chinese: “那個人，真是厚顏無恥。“她像一隻餓豹繞著這個房間來回地走著。
sentence.english: 「That creature - of all the nerve - 」 she prowled round the room like an angry leopard.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 女同性戀的; [名詞] 女同性戀者
[副詞] 較小地,較少地;不如

sentence.chinese: 倫敦的降雨量比曼徹斯特少。
sentence.english: It rains less in London than in Manchester.

sentence.chinese: 他不如她高。
sentence.english: He is less tall than she is.

sentence.chinese: 淡色通過加白色使濃度變化而形成的一種顏色分級
sentence.english: A gradation of a color made by adding white to it to lessen its saturation.

sentence.chinese: 緩衝物，緩衝地帶可用來隔離潛在的對抗性因來的東西，如面敵對勢力用來減輕衝突危險的地帶
sentence.english: Something that separates potentially antagonistic entities, as an area between two rival powers that serves to lessen the danger of conflict.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 較小的;更少的;次要的

sentence.chinese: 此案已由上訴法庭轉給下級法庭處理。
sentence.english: The case has been remitted from the appeal court to a lesser tribunal.

sentence.chinese: 她也受到波及，但程度較輕。
sentence.english: She has also been affected, but to a lesser degree.

sentence.chinese: 第一段聖經選自《約翰福音》。
sentence.english: The first lesson is taken from St John's Gospel.

sentence.chinese: 昨天我誤了一節課。
sentence.english: I missed a lesson yesterday.

sentence.chinese: 當心你的帽子別被吹走。
sentence.english: Beware your hat, lest it should be blown away.

sentence.chinese: 為了預防回來以前天就黑了，所以他帶著手電筒。
sentence.english: He took a flashlight lest it should get dark before he returned.

sentence.chinese: 我並不完全同意你說的話，但我不再多說了。
sentence.english: I don't agree with all you say, but I'll let it go at that.

sentence.chinese: 讓我想想看－－我把帽子落在哪兒了？
sentence.english: Let me see where did I leave my hat?

word.chinese: [形容詞] 致命的;危險的;毀滅性的

sentence.chinese: 在這種情況下，她真希望自己有一把槍或什麼致命武器。
sentence.english: In situation like this, she wish she have a gun or some lethal weapon.

sentence.chinese: 路上的坑坑窪窪騎車的人一不小心就有致命危險。
sentence.english: Pot-holes can be lethal for the unwary cyclist.

sentence.chinese: 這封信裡沒有什麼特別重要的事。
sentence.english: There was nothing in the letter of particular importance.

sentence.chinese: 這個郵箱每天開兩次。
sentence.english: There are two collections a day from this letter box.

sentence.chinese: 我要烤牛肉加瑞士乳酪、蕃茄與萵苣。
sentence.english: I'd like roast beef with swiss cheese, tomato, and lettuce.

sentence.chinese: 我喜歡這種脆萵苣和番茄做的沙拉，很好吃。
sentence.english: I like the delicious salad of crisp lettuce and tomatos.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 水平的,平的;筆直的; [名詞] 水平線

sentence.chinese: 這兩幅畫掛得不一般高，這幅比那幅高。
sentence.english: The two pictures are not quite level that one is higher than the other.

sentence.chinese: 我們必須提高生產水平。
sentence.english: We must increase production levels.

word.chinese: [動詞] (用槓桿)撬起;用控制桿操縱; [名詞] 槓桿;控制桿;手段

sentence.chinese: 這撬棒準是用於不可告人的目的的。
sentence.english: This lever must serve some ulterior purpose.

sentence.chinese: 用力推就能把控制桿按下去。
sentence.english: Push hard and the lever will go down.

word.chinese: [動詞] 徵收(稅等);強索; [名詞] 徵稅;稅款

sentence.chinese: 法庭可能不得不扣押你的房地產，用來償付你的債務。
sentence.english: The court may have to levy on your estate to pay your debts.

sentence.chinese: 稅為某一特定目的徵收的費用; 稅或徵稅
sentence.english: A payment exacted for a special purpose; an impost or a levy.

sentence.chinese: 如果你所負的債超過你的資產，你就會破產。
sentence.english: If your liabilities exceed your assets, you may go bankrupt.

sentence.chinese: 多吃一些維生素會減少你得感冒的可能性。
sentence.english: Taking extra vitamins may reduce your liability to colds.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 易...的;可能的;負有法律責任的

sentence.chinese: 我們都易犯錯誤。
sentence.english: We are liable to make mistakes.

sentence.chinese: 不繳納稅款就可能被起訴。
sentence.english: Failure to pay your taxes will make you liable to prosecution.

sentence.chinese: 你這個卑鄙的撒謊的人！
sentence.english: You scabby liar!

sentence.chinese: 你會蠢到相信那騙子說的話嗎?
sentence.english: Are you simple enough to believe what that liar tells you?

word.chinese: [動詞] (用文字等)誹謗; [名詞] (利用文字等的)誹謗(罪)

sentence.chinese: 他企圖敗壞對手名聲反而自食其果，被控以誹謗罪。
sentence.english: His attempt to discredit his opponent boomeranged (on him) when he was charged with libel.

sentence.chinese: 我要以誹謗罪控告你。
sentence.english: I'll sue you for libel.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 自由主義的; [名詞] 自由主義者

sentence.chinese: 他的觀點缺乏一貫性: 時而保守，時而開明。
sentence.english: His views lack consistency: one day he's a conservative, the next he's a liberal.

sentence.chinese: 她那些開明的觀點很快地就暴露出只不過是做做樣子而已。
sentence.english: Her liberal views were soon revealed as mere posturing.

sentence.chinese: 文學與藝術有自由化的動向。
sentence.english: There is a move to liberalize literature and the Arts.

sentence.chinese: 這個國家是在1966年解放的。
sentence.english: The country was liberated in 1966.

sentence.chinese: 我們的軍隊解放了許多地區。
sentence.english: Our army had liberated many occupied areas.

sentence.chinese: 解放前，他們一家住在茅屋裡。
sentence.english: The family lived in a thatched cottage before liberation.

sentence.chinese: 解放後這個地區的畜牧業得到了巨大的發展。
sentence.english: The animal husbandry in this area has developed greatly after liberation.

sentence.chinese: 你不在的時候我擅自借用了你的刈草機。
sentence.english: I took the liberty of borrowing your lawn-mower while you were away.

sentence.chinese: 對不起，我無權討論這個問題。
sentence.english: I am afraid that I am not at liberty to discuss this matter.

sentence.chinese: 她詢問圖書館管理員，他們有沒有這本書。
sentence.english: She inquired of the librarian whether they had got the book.

sentence.chinese: 我已經請求圖書管理員給我查找一本有關蝴蝶的書。
sentence.english: I have asked the librarian to look me out book on butterflies.

sentence.chinese: 在圖書館裡，歷史方面的書都放在同一隔間裡。
sentence.english: In the library, the books on history are all kept in one bay.

sentence.chinese: 你每次借書都必須出示借書證。
sentence.english: You must present your library ticket every time youborrow books.

word.chinese: [動詞] 許可,准許;發許可證給; [名詞] 許可,特許

sentence.chinese: 他現在可以獲得駕駛執照了。
sentence.english: He can obtain a driver's license now.

sentence.chinese: 他已領駕駛執照了。
sentence.english: He has taken out a driving license.

word.chinese: [動詞] 舔; [名詞] 舔,舐;少量

sentence.chinese: 輸者廢然而返以重整旗鼓。
sentence.english: The disappointed losers crawled home to lick their wounds.

sentence.chinese: 貓把奶舔乾淨了。
sentence.english: The cat licked up its milk.

sentence.chinese: 我蓋不上[取不下]蓋子。
sentence.english: I can't get the lid on/off.

sentence.chinese: 她用鑿子來把蓋子鑿開。
sentence.english: She used a chisel to prise off the lid.

word.chinese: [動詞] 說謊;躺; [名詞] 謊言

sentence.chinese: 消除緊張的方法在於學會放鬆。
sentence.english: The cure for stress lies in learning to relax.

sentence.chinese: 他為了參軍謊報了年齡。
sentence.english: He lied about his age to join the army.

word.chinese: [名詞] 中尉(或少尉);助理官

sentence.chinese: 一名年輕的中尉被任命擔任這項職務。
sentence.english: A young lieutenant was named for duty.

sentence.chinese: 你期待什麼呢? 這就是生活！
sentence.english: What do you expect? That's life!

sentence.chinese: 兒童總是那麼朝氣蓬勃的
sentence.english: Children are always so full of life.

sentence.chinese: 乘客及船員都被多佛爾的救生艇救出。
sentence.english: The passengers and crew were brought off by the Dover lifeboat.

sentence.chinese: 需要有人來做救生艇的船員。
sentence.english: Men are needed to crew the lifeboat.

sentence.chinese: 救生員跳入海中，拯救溺水的婦女。
sentence.english: The lifeguard dived into the sea to save the drowning woman.

sentence.chinese: 傑克想到明年夏天將在海灘作救生員工作，心裡十分高興。
sentence.english: Jack is licking his chops about the lifeguard job he will have at the beach next summer.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 終身的;一輩子的

sentence.chinese: 一位佔星家對說她將在二十多歲時遇到自己的終身伴侶。
sentence.english: An astrologer tell her that she will meet her lifelong companion in her twenties.

sentence.chinese: 他選擇了遺傳工程學作為終生的事業。
sentence.english: He chose genetic engineering to be his lifelong career.

sentence.chinese: 樸真的生活方式
sentence.english: An organic lifestyle.

sentence.chinese: 他決定拋棄自己已習慣在的在父母身邊的生活方式而開始自己的生活方式。
sentence.english: He's decided to throw over the lifestyle he's been used to in his parents' home, and go his own way.

sentence.chinese: 你能甘心一輩子失業嗎?
sentence.english: Could you reconcile yourself to a lifetime of unemployment?

sentence.chinese: 政府不大可能在本屆國會(會期)內通過該項法案。
sentence.english: The government is unlikely to get the bill through within (the lifetime of) this Parliament.

word.chinese: [動詞] 舉起; [名詞] 提,吊,升;鼓舞

sentence.chinese: 霧開始消散。
sentence.english: The mist began to lift.

sentence.chinese: 我把孩子從樹上抱了下來。
sentence.english: I lifted the child down from the tree.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 輕的; [動詞] 點(火);點燃;照亮; [副詞] 輕地;輕裝地; [名詞] 光線;燈

sentence.chinese: 她出事以後只能做輕活兒了。
sentence.english: Since her accident she can only do light work.

sentence.chinese: 天漸漸亮了。
sentence.english: It's beginning to get light.

sentence.chinese: 如果你想減輕體重，最好少吃麵包。
sentence.english: If you want to lighten the weight, had better eat little bread.

sentence.chinese: 一支孤燭使黑暗的房間亮了起來。
sentence.english: A solitary candle lightened the darkness of the room.

sentence.chinese: 燈塔在遠處發出閃爍的光。
sentence.english: A lighthouse was flashing in the distance.

sentence.chinese: 燈塔在船的正橫方向。
sentence.english: The lighthouse was abeam of the ship.

word.chinese: [名詞] 照明;點火;照明設備

sentence.chinese: 舞檯燈光產生月夜景色的效果。
sentence.english: The stage lighting give the effect of a moonlit scene.

sentence.chinese: 枝形吊燈一種枝形裝飾性的照明裝置，裝有一燈泡或蠟燭並懸掛在天花板上
sentence.english: A branched, decorative lighting fixture that holds a number of bulbs or candles and is suspended from a ceiling.

sentence.chinese: 那黑洞洞的房間頓時被強烈的閃電照亮了。
sentence.english: The dark room was momentarily lit up by a vivid flash of lightning.

sentence.chinese: 那棵樹被雷電擊中了。
sentence.english: The tree was struck by lightning.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 輕量級的;輕量的;無足輕重的; [名詞] 重量低的人(或物);無足輕重的人

sentence.chinese: 撐裙箍帶裙環女裙中的很輕的環形支撐物
sentence.english: One of the lightweight circular supports for a hoop skirt.

sentence.chinese: 比較輕的衣物; 比較輕的木材
sentence.english: Lightweight clothing; a lightweight wood.

word.chinese: [動詞] 喜歡; [介係詞] 像;如

sentence.chinese: 我看你的新助手不錯－－她看樣子很能幹。
sentence.english: I like the look of your new assistant she should do very well.

sentence.chinese: 他這個人有點勢利－－不會和我這樣的人說話。
sentence.english: He's a bit of a snob won't speak to the likes of me.

sentence.chinese: 預後從病中痊癒的可能性
sentence.english: The likelihood of recovery from a disease.

sentence.chinese: 可能性，或然性可能的性質或狀況; 可能性
sentence.english: The quality or condition of being probable; likelihood.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 有可能的; [副詞] 很可能

sentence.chinese: 我聽到傳聞說公司很可能要破產。
sentence.english: I've heard whispers that the firm is likely to go bankrupt.

sentence.chinese: 我想我很可能得到這份工作，可是假設鮑勃也申請的話，那[他]可能使我的計畫落空。
sentence.english: I think I'm likely to get the job, but if Bob applies for it too it/he could queer my pitch.

sentence.chinese: 她用附子汁向阿拉喀涅灑去，她的頭髮馬上就脫光了，她的鼻子和耳朵也掉了。
sentence.english: She sprinkled her with the juices of aconite, and immediately her hair came off, and her nose and ears likewise.

sentence.chinese: 注意看著他然後照樣做。
sentence.english: Watch him and do likewise.

sentence.chinese: 漂亮的姑娘加上化裝，是錦上添花。
sentence.english: For the beautiful girl to use makeup would be to gild the lily.

sentence.chinese: 對一個這樣漂亮的女孩來說，化妝有些畫蛇添足。
sentence.english: For such a beautiful girl, to use make-up would be to gild the lily.

sentence.chinese: 止血帶、壓脈器一種裝置，特指一緊緊環繞的繃帶，通過暫時阻止血液從四肢的較大動脈中流過而止血
sentence.english: A device, typically a tightly encircling bandage, used to check bleeding by temporarily stopping the flow of blood through a large artery in a limb.

sentence.chinese: 小腿，脛位於膝蓋和腳之間的腿部或後肢的部位; 脛
sentence.english: The section of the leg or hind limb between the knee and foot; shank.

sentence.chinese: 代基裡酒一種由朗姆酒、萊姆汁或檸檬汁和糖混合的加冰雞尾酒
sentence.english: An iced cocktail of rum, lime or lemon juice, and sugar.

sentence.chinese: 他往石灰裡加了些水。
sentence.english: He added some water into the lime.

word.chinese: [動詞] 限定; [名詞] 限度

sentence.chinese: 我僅探討這一問題的三個方面。
sentence.english: I shall limit myself to three aspects of the subject.

sentence.chinese: 我願適當予以幫助。
sentence.english: I'm willing to help, within limits.

sentence.chinese: 追訴期限一個時間限制，若超過該時間限制一個行動，債務或罪行則不再有效或不再可實施
sentence.english: The limitation of time beyond which an action, a debt, or a crime is no longer valid or enforceable.

sentence.chinese: 更改小小的改變，調正或限制
sentence.english: A small alteration, adjustment, or limitation.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 有限的,不多的;(公司)有限的

sentence.chinese: 我們與本地人的交往有限。
sentence.english: We had only limited communion with the natives.

sentence.chinese: 我們的基金有限而爭相申請的卻有幾處。
sentence.english: We have limited funds and several competing claims.

sentence.chinese: 這家飯店擁有一個運送客人去機場的豪華車隊。
sentence.english: The hotel has a fleet of limousine to take guest to the airport.

sentence.chinese: 一輛小型巴士載我們到博物館。
sentence.english: A limousine carried us to the museum.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 軟綿綿的;鬆弛的;無精神的; [動詞] 跛行; [名詞] 跛行

sentence.chinese: 他受傷後就一直瘸了。
sentence.english: The injury left him with a permanent limp.

sentence.chinese: 他腿瘸是事故所致。
sentence.english: His limp is the result of an accident.

word.chinese: [動詞] 排隊; [名詞] 線;隊伍

sentence.chinese: 他為晚會安排了一支充滿活力的樂隊。
sentence.english: He's lined up a live band for the party.

sentence.chinese: 她一貫奉行馬克思主義路線。
sentence.english: She always takes a Marxist line.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 直線的;長度的;線性的

sentence.chinese: 信息密度在一個線性維度內有用的信息單元的個數。
sentence.english: The number of units of useful information contained within a linear dimension.

sentence.chinese: 印字寬度的單位，以一英吋直線距離上能安置的字符數計。
sentence.english: A unit of type width based on the number of times a character can be set in one linear inch.

word.chinese: [名詞] 亞麻布製品(如床單,桌巾,內衣等)

sentence.chinese: [諺]家醜不可外揚。
sentence.english: Wash your dirty linen at home.

sentence.chinese: 亞麻布是以亞麻纖維為原料製造的。
sentence.english: Linen is produced from flax.

sentence.chinese: 據報導，這艘客輪與一艘油輪相撞。
sentence.english: The liner is reported to have been in collision with an oil tanker.

sentence.chinese: 班輪正在船塢修理。
sentence.english: The liner is in dock for a refit.

word.chinese: [名詞] 列隊;電視節目時間表
[動詞] 繼續逗留;持續;磨蹭

word.chinese: [名詞] 現代化;現代化的事物

sentence.english: No matter who he may be, he can play his part in the modernization of our country.

sentence.english: Any of numerous natural and synthetic compounds of usually high molecular weight consisting of up to millions of repeated linked units, each a relatively light and simple molecule.

sentence.chinese: 汽車展覽會上展出了今年所有的新型號。

sentence.chinese: 那個年輕人是一個汽車修理工。
sentence.english: That young man is a motor mechanic.

sentence.chinese: 修理之後，這輛摩托必須很好地試一次車。
sentence.english: Having been repaired, the motorcycle must be given a good road test.

sentence.chinese: 這次摩托車比賽不值一看。
sentence.english: The motorcycle race is not worth seeing

sentence.chinese: 事故發生的原因是一個汽車駕駛員完全誤解了另一個駕駛員的意圖。
sentence.english: The accident was caused by one motorist completely misapprehending the intentions of the other.

sentence.chinese: 懇求一位過路的汽車司機給予幫助
sentence.english: Invoked the help of a passing motorist.

sentence.chinese: 高速公路上隔一段距離就有一個示警牌。

sentence.chinese: 警察說他在高速公路上違章超速行駛。
sentence.english: The police said he'd been speeding on the motorway.

sentence.chinese: 我玩紙牌經常贏，可一分錢也存不住--我的俗話是『來得容易，去得快′.
sentence.english: I often win money at cards but never save a penny `easy come, easy go' is my motto.

sentence.chinese: 「三思而後行」是我的座右銘。
sentence.english: 「Think before you act」 is my motto.

word.chinese: [名詞] 土墩;墳堆;小丘;投手的踏板

sentence.chinese: 堤用以阻擋水或支持公路而建造的土堆或石堆
sentence.english: A mound of earth or stone built to hold back water or to support a roadway.

sentence.chinese: 炮墩，炮座堡壘內部的平台或土墩，大炮可從中越過胸牆而發射
sentence.english: A platform or mound of earth within a fort from which guns are fired over the parapet.

word.chinese: [動詞] 登上;騎上;鑲嵌;發動(攻勢); [名詞] 騎;可乘騎的東西;底座;山丘

sentence.chinese: 他騎上馬走了。
sentence.english: He mounted the horse and rode off.

sentence.chinese: [諺]切勿小題大做。
sentence.english: Never make a mountain of a molehill.

sentence.chinese: 山腳下有幾排帳篷。
sentence.english: There are rows of tents at the foot of the mountain.

sentence.chinese: 他住在山區。
sentence.english: He lives in a mountainous district.

sentence.chinese: 那座巨大的島嶼隱隱約約浮現在地平線上。
sentence.english: The mountainous island loomed on the horizon.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 騎馬的;架設好的;鑲嵌的

sentence.chinese: 俱樂部的展品裝在大型花車上在大街上通過。

sentence.chinese: 那些警察騎著黑色的馬。
sentence.english: The policemen were mounted on (ie rode) black horses.

sentence.chinese: 人們戴著黑紗哀悼我們的領導。

sentence.chinese: 這位老太太還在為兒子的死傷心。
sentence.english: The old woman still mourns for her son.

sentence.chinese: 貓一動不動地等著老鼠出洞。
sentence.english: The cat remained motionless, waiting for the mouse to come out of its hole.

sentence.chinese: 他在炫耀他那一簇鬍子。
sentence.english: He was sporting a moustache.

sentence.chinese: 帶來壞消息; 留絡腮鬍子的男人

sentence.english: A woodwind instrument having a straight, cylindrical tube with a flaring bell and a single-reed mouthpiece, played by means of finger holes and keys.

sentence.english: A toy instrument with a membrane that produces a sound when a player hums or sings into the mouthpiece.

sentence.english: His movables are quite valuable.

sentence.chinese: 感恩節的日期每年不同。

sentence.english: The government's announcement is seen as a move towards settling the strike.

sentence.chinese: 公眾輿論正在強烈支持裁軍。
sentence.english: Public opinion was moving strongly in favor of disarmament.

sentence.chinese: 他最後的那部影片一塌糊塗。
sentence.english: His last movie was a real turkey.

sentence.english: We are supposed to dress up as movie characters for the party, what a novel idea!

word.chinese: [形容詞] 行進的;移動的;搬家的

sentence.chinese: 公眾輿論正在強烈支持裁軍。
sentence.english: Public opinion was moving strongly in favor of disarmament.

sentence.chinese: 我知道火車已經停了，但我覺得火車在倒退。
sentence.english: I knew the train had stopped, but I had the sensation that it was moving backwards.

sentence.chinese: 再見啦！
sentence.english: Bye mow!

sentence.english: In summer we mow our lawn once a week.

sentence.english: I'll let you borrow my lawn mower if I can use your electric drill; after all, fair exchange is no robbery.

sentence.chinese: 園丁向我要一台旋轉式割草機。
sentence.english: The gardener asked me for a rotary lawn mower.

sentence.chinese: 布朗先生極少說話。
sentence.english: Mr. Brown talks least.

sentence.chinese: 瓊斯先生是個巧木匠。
sentence.english: Mr. Jones is a clever carpenter.

sentence.chinese: 希爾先生和夫人招待客人真周到。
sentence.english: Mr and Mrs Hill are such good hosts.

sentence.chinese: 希爾先生獲得3000 多票。
sentence.english: Mr. Hill polled over 3000 votes.

sentence.chinese: 但是，作為一位職業社會學家和女權運動者，露西小姐並不覺得奇怪。她也不在乎。
sentence.english: Ms Lucy, as a professional sociologist and committed feminist, is, however, not surprised. Nor is she amused.

sentence.chinese: 哦，喂，Richardson女士，我剛傳真一份文件給你。
sentence.english: Oh, hello, Ms. Richardson. I just sent you a fax.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 很多的; [副詞] 非常;很;差不多,幾乎; [代名詞] 許多,大量;重要的事物

sentence.chinese: 我倒是很願意呆在這兒，可確實得回家了。
sentence.english: Much as I would like to stay, I really must go home.

sentence.chinese: 我不要布丁了－－我能把第一道大菜吃完就已經很不容易了。
sentence.english: I won't have a pudding it was as much as I could do to finish the very large first course.

sentence.chinese: 我的車陷入泥中，一動也不動。
sentence.english: My car's stuck in the mud, and it won't budge.

sentence.english: He removed the mud from his shoes.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 多爛泥的;泥濘的

word.chinese: [動詞] 自背後襲擊並搶劫; [名詞] (有柄)大杯子

sentence.chinese: 騾是馬和驢交配而生的雜種。

sentence.chinese: 朋友之間，歡樂同享，苦難同當。

sentence.chinese: 以無窮數乘y。

sentence.chinese: 開設市場攤位受市政法令管制。

sentence.chinese: 溫徹斯特區英格蘭中南部一自治區，位於倫敦西南。是盎格魯－撒克遜時期西撒克斯王國的首府。在諾曼征服(1066年)以後，成為一個吸引了眾多宗教學者的重要學術中心。人口32,100。
sentence.english: A municipal borough of south-central England southwest of London. The capital of the Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Wessex, it was an important center of learning that attracted many religious scholars after the Norman Conquest(1066). Population, 32,100.

word.chinese: [動詞] 謀殺,兇殺; [名詞] 謀殺,兇殺

sentence.chinese: 他的父母和姐姐都是被恐怖分子殺害的。
sentence.english: His parents and sister were all murdered by the terrorists.

sentence.chinese: 那位著名的政治家去年被謀殺了。

sentence.english: An angry murmur ran through the crowd.

sentence.chinese: 竊竊私語的聲音變大形成一片喧嘩。

sentence.english: Any of a branching system of muscular, elastic tubes that carry blood away from the heart to the cells, tissues, and organs of the body.

sentence.chinese: 公牛般的有健壯的、肌肉發達的體格的
sentence.english: Having a heavy, muscular physique.

sentence.english: Shaved off his mustache.

sentence.chinese: 〞我不愛吃芥末，這東西太辣了。〞

sentence.english: My husband and I got pay rises of 8% and 10% respectively.

sentence.chinese: 我說清楚了嗎?
sentence.english: Do I make myself clear?

sentence.chinese: 我今天心神不寧。
sentence.english: I'm not myself today.

sentence.english: The enchanter is very mysterious.

sentence.english: There are many mysterious stories about the Egyptian pyramids.

sentence.english: The crimes committed there invested the place with an air of mystery and gloom.

sentence.chinese: 那是無法解釋的奧秘。
sentence.english: It's an insoluble mystery.

word.chinese: [名詞] 神話;虛構的人(或事物)

sentence.english: The myth that eating carrot improved your eyesight was exploded years ago.

sentence.english: Diana is the goddess of hunting in Greek and Latin mythology.

sentence.english: A satyr is half man and half goat in Greek and Roman mythology.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使煩惱;糾纏不休;不斷嘮叨; [名詞] 好嘮叨的人

sentence.chinese: 一些孩子報怨他們父母老是數落他們。
sentence.english: Some children complain that their parents nag at them.

sentence.chinese: 別在我面前嘮叨！

word.chinese: [動詞] 將...釘牢;捕獲;揭露;擊,打; [名詞] 釘子;指甲

sentence.english: He is so naive as to believe such a lie.

sentence.english: She was such a prude that she was even embarrassed by the sight of naked children.

sentence.chinese: 這顆星肉眼看不見。
sentence.english: This star is not visible to the naked eye.

word.chinese: [動詞] 給...取名;列舉; [名詞] 名字

sentence.english: I greet you in the name of the President.

sentence.english: He writes under the name of Nimrod.

sentence.chinese: 也就是說; 就是

word.chinese: [動詞] 打盹,小睡; [名詞] 打盹兒

sentence.english: He was aroused from his nap by the doorbell.

sentence.chinese: 我有個睡午覺的習慣。

sentence.english: In the Patent Office, we still have millions of ideas that are free for use.

sentence.chinese: 他們在碎石小徑上散步。

sentence.chinese: 我們沿礫石小路顛簸而行。
sentence.english: We bumped up and down along the gravel path.

sentence.chinese: 真讓人洩氣！
sentence.english: How pathetic!

sentence.chinese: 她跳舞跳得好，但唱歌就差勁了。
sentence.english: She dances well, but as a singer, she is pathetic.

word.chinese: [名詞] 耐心;忍耐;耐性;毅力

sentence.chinese: 無限的耐心使她成為這個醫院最好的護士。
sentence.english: Her endless patience made her the best nurse in the hospital.

sentence.chinese: 他出事後重新學習走路要有極大的毅力。
sentence.english: Learning to walk again after his accident required great patience.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 有耐心的,能忍受的; [名詞] 病人

sentence.chinese: 一大群人耐心地靜候著。
sentence.english: A patient throng was waiting in silence.

sentence.chinese: 這個病人晚飯前什麼東西都沒吃。
sentence.english: The patient took no nourishment all day until dinner.

sentence.chinese: 普瓦斯基，卡齊米爾1747－1779波蘭愛國主義者和將軍，在美國獨立戰爭中曾支持美軍，指揮了查理斯頓防禦戰(1779年)並在薩瓦納之圍時率領一個騎兵旅，在這場戰鬥中受重傷而犧牲
sentence.english: Polish patriot and general who aided American forces in the Revolutionary War, commanding the defense of Charleston(1779) and leading a cavalry brigade in the siege of Savannah, during which he was mortally wounded.

sentence.chinese: 埃米特，羅伯特1778－1803愛爾蘭愛國主義者，他為愛爾蘭天主教的權利而戰，在反對英國的事件中，因失敗而被處決
sentence.english: Irish patriot who fought for the rights of Irish Catholics and was executed for his part in a bungled uprising against the British.

sentence.chinese: 萬歲日本人在進攻時的吶喊或愛國的歡呼；
sentence.english: A Japanese battle cry or patriotic cheer.

sentence.chinese: 他的愛國行為激起了我們的敬佩。
sentence.english: His patriotic action raised our admiration.

word.chinese: [動詞] 巡邏;巡查; [名詞] 巡邏;巡邏兵

sentence.chinese: 我們不得不冒著可能遇上敵人巡邏兵的危險。
sentence.english: We'll have to chance meeting an enemy patrol.

sentence.chinese: 巡邏隊遭到土匪伏擊。
sentence.english: The patrol was waylaid by bandits.

word.chinese: [名詞] 贊助者;主顧(尤指老顧客)

sentence.chinese: 聖‧克裡斯托弗是旅行者的守護神。
sentence.english: St Christopher is the patron saint of travellers.

sentence.chinese: 庇護，保護保護人對某人、機構、事件或事業的支持、鼓勵或維護
sentence.english: Support, encouragement, or championship, as of a person, an institution, an event, or a cause, from a patron.

sentence.chinese: 某企業的客戶或企圖尋求優惠或贊助的某機構的客人的旅行
sentence.english: One taken by a person who is the guest of a business or an agency seeking favor or patronage.

sentence.chinese: 這個交響樂團是在政府贊助下成立的。
sentence.english: This orchestra has been established under the patronage of the government.

sentence.chinese: 我們臥室的壁紙是蘭花圖案的。
sentence.english: The wallpaper in our bedroom has a pattern of orchids.

sentence.chinese: 窗簾上繪有精美的花卉圖案。
sentence.english: The curtains had an elaborate pattern of flowers.

word.chinese: [動詞] 中止; [名詞] 暫停,間歇;躊躇,猶豫

sentence.chinese: 地獄裡滿地都是好意。

word.chinese: [名詞] 鋪築過的地面;人行道

sentence.chinese: 遊客把人行道擠得水洩不通。
sentence.english: Tourists crowded the pavement.

sentence.chinese: 便道上滿是狗屎。

word.chinese: [動詞] (用腳爪等)抓;扒; [名詞] 腳爪;爪子

sentence.chinese: 那條狗在嗥叫--它的爪子受傷了。
sentence.english: The dog was howling its paw was hurt.

sentence.chinese: 我踩了那狗的爪子，它嚎叫了一聲。
sentence.english: The dog gave a yelp when I trod on its paw.

word.chinese: [動詞] 付錢; [名詞] 薪俸;報酬;報償;懲罰

sentence.chinese: 她不把我們的警告放在心上。
sentence.english: She paid no heed to our warnings.

sentence.chinese: 他每星期五領工資。
sentence.english: He gets his pay each Friday.

sentence.chinese: 他們在付款問題上陷入長期糾紛。
sentence.english: They were involved in a long legal wrangle over payment.

sentence.chinese: 貨款可以分期支付。
sentence.english: The payment of the goods is payable in instalments.

sentence.chinese: 豌豆過熟就會爆裂。
sentence.english: Pea pods burst open when overripe.

sentence.english: A pod, such as that of a pea or bean, that splits into two valves with the seeds attached to one edge of the valves.

sentence.chinese: 鄉村的寧靜很快就使他的怒氣平靜下來。

sentence.chinese: 在鄉間有一種和平寧靜的氣氛，和大城市的氣氛截然不同。
sentence.english: There is an atmosphere of peace and calm in the country, quite different from the atmosphere of a big city.

word.chinese: [名詞] 維護和平;停火協定的執行

sentence.chinese: 我們希望能夠和平過渡到新的制度。
sentence.english: We hope there will be a peaceful transition to the new system.

sentence.chinese: 他很安詳地去世。
sentence.english: His ending was peaceful.

sentence.chinese: 桃上有一層細毛。
sentence.english: A peach skin is covered with fuzz.

sentence.chinese: 桃子上的絨毛
sentence.english: The fuzz on a peach.

sentence.chinese: 麻雀看見孔雀負擔著它的翎尾，替它擔憂。
sentence.english: The sparrow is sorry for the peacock at the burden of its tail.

sentence.english: Children shout when they see the peacock spread his gorgeous tail.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 最高的,高峰的; [動詞] 使尖起;達到高峰;聳起; [名詞] 山頂;頂端

sentence.english: Property prices have peaked.

sentence.chinese: 山頂上終年積雪。
sentence.english: The mountain peaks are covered with snow all year.

word.chinese: [名詞] 花生;花生果;花生米

sentence.chinese: 一瓶花生醬多少錢？

sentence.chinese: 他喜歡吃花生醬。

sentence.chinese: 梨樹的樹枝給沉甸甸的果實壓彎了。

sentence.chinese: 那裡有許多開滿花的梨樹。

word.chinese: [形容詞] 外表或顏色像珍珠的; [名詞] 珍珠

sentence.chinese: 記憶猶如一個沿著海邊行走的孩子。你永遠無法知道它會揀起哪塊小石頭珍藏起來。

sentence.english: A period of time during which motor vehicular and pedestrian traffic is light.

sentence.english: He erases pencil marks.

sentence.english: I wonder if you stock any Penguin jacket?

sentence.english: A promontory of southeast Newfoundland, Canada, on the coast of the Avalon Peninsula.

sentence.chinese: 阿克巴灣紅海的一個海灣，在西奈半島及沙特阿拉伯西北部之間。它長期以來在中東具有重要的戰略性
sentence.english: An arm of the Red Sea between the Sinai Peninsula and northwest Saudi Arabia. It has long been of strategic importance in the Middle East.

sentence.chinese: 六年前，他來到這個國家時一文不名。
sentence.english: He arrived in this country six years ago without a penny.

sentence.chinese: 他每花一便士都非常吝惜。
sentence.english: He grudges every penny he has to spend.

sentence.chinese: 養老金的多少取決於為公司服務年限的長短。
sentence.english: Size of pension depends on length of service with the company.

sentence.chinese: 除了國家發的養老金，他一無所有。
sentence.english: He's got nothing beyond his state pension.

sentence.chinese: 單身養老金領取者的徵稅起點是450美元。
sentence.english: The tax threshold for a single pensioner is 450 dollars.

sentence.english: They are all old-age pensioners.

sentence.chinese: 她與親人一起過聖誕節。

sentence.chinese: 這食物中的胡椒味兒嗆得我直打噴嚏。
sentence.english: The pepper in the food caused me to/made me sneeze.

sentence.english: Ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, pepper and cloves are common spices.

sentence.chinese: 我們以每小時七十英里的速度(在高速公路上)飛馳。
sentence.english: We were bowling along (the motorway) at seventy miles per hour.

sentence.chinese: 這艘船的停泊稅一年是五千美元。
sentence.english: The vessel tax of anchorage is 5,000 dollars per year.

sentence.chinese: 據觀察所見，病人站立和行走都有困難。
sentence.english: The patient was perceived to have difficulty in standing and walking.

sentence.english: We give 10 percent discount for cash.

sentence.english: The company's market share is 48 percent in the marketplace.

sentence.chinese: 威士忌所含酒精的百分比很高。
sentence.english: Whisky contains a large percentage of alcohol.

sentence.chinese: 現在人類所使用的所有纖維之中，有很大的百分比是人造的。
sentence.english: Of all the fibers now used by man, a very large percentage is man-made.

sentence.chinese: 神經心理學心理學的分支，研究神經系統特別是腦神經系統與諸如語言、記憶、知覺等腦功能或心理功能之間相互關係的科學
sentence.english: The branch of psychology that deals with the relationship between the nervous system, especially the brain, and cerebral or mental functions such as language, memory, and perception.

sentence.chinese: 他對該問題的分析顯示出敏銳的洞察力。
sentence.english: His analysis of the problem showed great perception.

word.chinese: [動詞] (鳥)飛落;棲息;(在較高處)暫歇; [名詞] (鳥類的)棲息處
[形容詞] 終年的;常年的; [名詞] 多年生植物

sentence.chinese: 樹一種多年生木質植物，生有一個主幹且常有一個很明顯的樹冠
sentence.english: A perennial woody plant having a main trunk and usually a distinct crown.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 完美的; [動詞] 使完美;做完

sentence.chinese: 沒人指望你完美無缺，但是我們盼望你永遠盡最大的努力。
sentence.english: No one expects you to be perfect, but we do expect you to do your best always.

sentence.chinese: 他自以為他說法語的腔調很完美。
sentence.english: He flattered himself that he spoke French with a perfect accent.

sentence.english: She takes off the Prime Minister to perfection.

sentence.chinese: 我還在學習，別指望我十全十美！
sentence.english: I'm still only a learner, so don't expect perfection!

word.chinese: [副詞] 完美地;圓滿地;完全地,絕對地

sentence.english: He is an excellent athlete; all his movements are perfectly coordinated.

sentence.chinese: 他根本沒喝醉。
sentence.english: He is perfectly sober.

word.chinese: [動詞] 履行;執行;表演, 演奏

sentence.chinese: 現在激光可以用來做手術。
sentence.english: Lasers can be used to perform operations nowadays.

sentence.chinese: 公證人被授權執行某些法律職能。

sentence.chinese: 他每次開汽車都總是不厭其煩地把油和水整個檢查一遍。
sentence.english: He goes through the whole performance of checking the oil and water every time he drives the car.

sentence.english: The novel is considered a brilliant performance.

word.chinese: [名詞] 演出者;演奏者;表演者

sentence.chinese: 伴奏為一個演奏者配音伴奏
sentence.english: A background accompaniment, as for a performer.

sentence.chinese: 吞火魔術師假裝吞火的表演者
sentence.english: A performer who pretends to swallow fire.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使充滿香氣; [名詞] 香水;香料

sentence.chinese: 這種香水聞起來怎樣?
sentence.english: What does the perfume smell like?

sentence.chinese: 空屋裡仍然飄溢著她的香水味。

word.chinese: [形容詞] 無力量的,軟弱的

sentence.chinese: 科學家們正在探索在空間摧毀核武器的方法－也就是使該武器失去威力或不再起作用。
sentence.english: Scientists are searching for ways to destroy nuclear weapons powerless and no longer useful.

sentence.chinese: 《亞伯拉罕‧林肯：草原歲月》(1926)和《亞伯拉罕‧林肯：戰爭年代》(1939)。
sentence.english: He wrote a biography of Lincoln in two parts Abraham Lincoln: the Prairie Years(1926) and Abraham Lincoln: the War Years(1939).

sentence.chinese: 在1939年大戰爆發的前幾年，希特勒沒開一搶而成功地把歐洲許多地區併吞為德國領土。

sentence.english: Falling interest rates present the firm with a new problem.

word.chinese: [動詞] 畫側面像;描出輪廓;寫傳略; [名詞] 側影;輪廓;人物簡介

sentence.chinese: 在夜空的映襯下顯出大樹的輪廓。
sentence.english: The huge trees were profiled against the night sky.

sentence.chinese: 我從側面給他拍照。
sentence.english: I photographed him in profile.

word.chinese: [動詞] 得益,獲益; [名詞] 利潤,盈利;收益

sentence.chinese: 你做那件事沒有什麼好處。
sentence.english: It will profit you nothing to do that.

sentence.chinese: 你可以從我的錯誤中得到教訓，避免犯同樣錯誤。
sentence.english: You can profit by my mistakes and avoid them yourself.

sentence.chinese: 他對德國的市場進行了研究以尋求投資獲利的可能性。
sentence.english: He studied the German market to find the potential there for profitable investment.

sentence.chinese: 他下決心每天要讀一小時有益讀物。
sentence.english: He made a resolution to read something profitable for one hour every day.

sentence.chinese: 別以為她的工作方法簡單，她說出話來是很有份量的。
sentence.english: Her simple style is deceptive: what she has to say is very profound.

sentence.chinese: 他自從失業以來，常覺百無聊賴。
sentence.english: Since losing his job, he has often experienced a profound sense of ennui.

word.chinese: [動詞] 為...安排節目;設計電腦程式; [名詞] 節目

sentence.chinese: 計畫正在進行中。
sentence.english: The program is under way.

sentence.chinese: 我們已經收到了對該節目的一連串投訴。
sentence.english: We have had a string of complaints about the program.

word.chinese: [動詞] 前進;進行;上進,提高,進步; [名詞] 進步

sentence.chinese: 這個學生學習上進步很快。
sentence.english: The student is showing rapid progress in his studies.

sentence.chinese: 船隻在洶湧的大海中緩慢前進。
sentence.english: The ship made slow progress through the rough sea.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 逐漸的; [名詞] 革新主義者

sentence.chinese: 她是那個時代最進步的作家。
sentence.english: She is the most progressive writer of those times.

sentence.chinese: 她是那個時代最進步的作家。
sentence.english: She is the most progressive writer of the time.

sentence.chinese: 這裡禁止吸菸。
sentence.english: Smoking is prohibited here.

sentence.chinese: 雨天和大霧妨礙了飛行。
sentence.english: Rainy weather and fog prohibited flying.

sentence.chinese: 禁止煤炭輸出。
sentence.english: Prohibition was laid on the export of coal.

sentence.chinese: 校園內嚴禁吸菸。
sentence.english: The prohibition against smoking on school grounds is strictly enforced.

word.chinese: [動詞] 計劃;企劃;突出,伸出;投射; [名詞] 計畫

sentence.chinese: 這個計畫耗資太大,我們只好退出。
sentence.english: The project became so expensive that we had to pull out.

sentence.chinese: 這個班在進行一項關於古羅馬人佔領不列顛的研究。
sentence.english: The class are doing a project on the Roman occupation of Britain.

word.chinese: [名詞] 規劃;投影;投射;預測

sentence.chinese: 星座一覽圖天體球的一半或多半在平面圖上的極投影圖，這種圖具有可調節的遮蔽物以顯示在給定時刻和位置可見的恆星
sentence.english: A polar projection of half or more of the celestial sphere on a chart equipped with an adjustable overlay to show the stars visible at a particular time and place.

sentence.chinese: 柄一個柄或凸出物，作為把手或抓的東西
sentence.english: A handle or projection used as a hold or support.

sentence.chinese: 彼得：你現在必須休息，別著急。索尼婭：他現在為我擔心了，可現在太遲了。我這一輩子被他逼到了這個地步，現在他還想繼續折磨我。
sentence.english: Peter: Now you must rest and take it easy. Sonia: Now he worries about me now, when it's too late. All my life he drives me to this point and now he wants to prolong the agony.

sentence.chinese: 我們怎樣才能延長短促的人生？
sentence.english: How can we endeavor to prolong the brevity of human life?

sentence.chinese: 會議可能要延長到夜裡，因為今晚有太多問題要解決。
sentence.english: The meeting may be prolonged into the evening because so many problems have to be solved tonight.

sentence.chinese: 代表們經過長時間的討論之後，終於想出一種大家都能接受的措辭方式。
sentence.english: After prolonged discussion, the representatives hammered out a form of words that was acceptable to everyone.

sentence.chinese: 骨瘦如柴的身材又細又瘦，骨骼突出的
sentence.english: Having a lean, gaunt frame with prominent bones.

sentence.chinese: 傑出的在同類中顯著的; 傑出的
sentence.english: Standing out among others of its kind; prominent.

word.chinese: [動詞] 答應; [名詞] 承諾,諾言;希望,前途

sentence.chinese: 新的銷售辦法可望取得良好效果。
sentence.english: The new sales policy promises well.

sentence.chinese: 我不相信他會如約前來訪問。
sentence.english: I don't trust his promise to come for a visit.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 有希望的,有前途的

sentence.chinese: 可我記得清清楚楚你是答應了要給我打電話！
sentence.english: But I distinctly remember you promising to phone me!

sentence.chinese: 這項計畫開始時很有希望,但不久就失敗了。
sentence.english: After a promising start, the project soon fizzled out.

sentence.chinese: 政府決定發展公共福利。
sentence.english: The government decided to promote public welfare.

sentence.chinese: 他喜歡讀偉人傳記來提高自己。
sentence.english: He likes to read biographies of great men to promote himself.

sentence.chinese: 你提升的希望只不過是一種幻覺。
sentence.english: Your hope of promotion is a mere delusion.

sentence.chinese: 今年的推銷活動不是很成功。
sentence.english: This year's sales promotions haven't been very successful.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 敏捷的;即時的,即期的; [動詞] 提示; [名詞] 催促;提醒

sentence.chinese: 他總是迅速回覆來信。
sentence.english: He is always prompt in answering letters.

sentence.chinese: 她對別人想出的主意總是迫不及待地批評。
sentence.english: She's always prompt to criticize other people's ideas.

word.chinese: [副詞] 敏捷地;迅速地;立即地

sentence.chinese: 及時付帳是理財的好習慣。
sentence.english: Paying bills promptly is good financial practice.

sentence.chinese: 由於醫生們行動迅速,那個女孩子得救了。
sentence.english: The girl's life was saved because the doctors acted so promptly.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 有...傾向的;俯伏的

sentence.chinese: 他動不動就生點小病。
sentence.english: He's prone to minor ailments.

sentence.chinese: 他易於發怒。
sentence.english: He was prone to anger.

sentence.chinese: 雙數格用於兩個物體或人時名詞、形容詞、代詞或動詞的曲折變化詞形
sentence.english: An inflected form of a noun, adjective, pronoun, or verb used with two items or people.

sentence.chinese: 所有的客人都說這頓飯好極了。
sentence.english: The dinner was pronounced excellent by all the guests.

sentence.chinese: 法庭宣判不承認我對這片土地的權益。
sentence.english: The court pronounced against my claim to the land.

sentence.chinese: 他的發音太糟了。
sentence.english: His pronunciation is simply terrible.

sentence.chinese: 你的發音毛病是可以糾正的。
sentence.english: Your faults of pronunciation can be remedied.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 不能穿透的,能抵擋的; [名詞] 證據;物證;證明

sentence.chinese: 你有什麼證據證明這輛自行車是你的？
sentence.english: Have you got any proof that you own this bike?

sentence.chinese: 士兵的勇氣在戰鬥中得到考驗。
sentence.english: A soldier's courage is put to the proof in battle.

word.chinese: [動詞] 支撐;維持;架;擱; [名詞] 支柱;支撐物;後盾;道具

sentence.chinese: 那病弱者倚靠在枕頭上。
sentence.english: The invalid lay propped on the pillows.

sentence.chinese: 坑道頂用木柱支撐。
sentence.english: The roof of the tunnel was supported by wooden props.

sentence.chinese: 怎樣才能抵銷敵人的宣傳?
sentence.english: How can we nullify the enemy's propaganda?

sentence.chinese: 反英宣傳觸犯了眾怒。
sentence.english: The anti-British propaganda gave (ie caused) much offence.

sentence.chinese: 他們辦了一份報紙來宣傳他們的主張。
sentence.english: They started a newspaper to propagate their ideas.

sentence.chinese: 大多數植物靠種子繁殖。
sentence.english: Most plants propagate by seed.

sentence.chinese: 我們被推著向前走。
sentence.english: We are propelled to go forward.

sentence.chinese: 他吸毒成癮使他走上了犯罪的道路。
sentence.english: His addiction to drugs propelled him towards a life of crime.

sentence.chinese: 翼剖面; 機翼; 翼面一個部件或平面，如機翼、螺旋槳葉、方向舵等，其形狀或方位控制穩定性、方向、抬升、衝擊或驅動
sentence.english: A part or surface, such as a wing, propeller blade, or rudder, whose shape and orientation control stability, direction, lift, thrust, or propulsion.

sentence.chinese: 旋翼機在飛行中以常規的螺旋槳來驅動並靠慣性滑行支持的，提供升力的水平旋轉儀
sentence.english: An aircraft powered by a conventional propeller and supported in flight by a freewheeling, horizontal rotor that provides lift.

sentence.chinese: 多年來她都沒有過真正的假期。
sentence.english: She hadn't had a proper holiday for years.

sentence.chinese: 他的母親已經把他訓練成循規蹈矩的人。
sentence.english: His mother has trained him to be a very proper young man.

sentence.chinese: 如果你不給機器好好加油的話，它就不會正常運轉。
sentence.english: The machine won't function properly if you don't oil it well.

sentence.chinese: 我汽車裡的暖氣設備出了點毛病。
sentence.english: The heater in my car doesn't work properly.

sentence.chinese: 我又不能料事如神，總不免要吃點小虧。
sentence.english: Since I cannot foretell things like a prophet, I cannot help taking a small loss.

sentence.chinese: 法蒂瑪伊斯蘭先知穆罕默德的女兒。她嫁給了首批皈依伊斯蘭教的阿里，被穆斯林認為是四個完美女人之一
sentence.english: Daughter of the Islamic prophet Mohammed. She married Ali, among the first to embrace Islam, and is considered by Moslems to be one of the Four Perfect Women.

sentence.chinese: 她的頭部與身體大小不成比例。
sentence.english: Her head is out of proportion to the size of her body.

sentence.chinese: 我們正努力把問題縮小到可以控制的範圍內。
sentence.english: We are trying to reduce the problem to manageable proportions.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 成比例的;相稱的

sentence.chinese: 定額一定比例的份額，如貨物，分配給一組或一組中的每個成員; 配給物
sentence.english: A proportional share, as of goods, assigned to a group or to each member of a group; an allotment.

sentence.chinese: 用於修飾或說明一種設備(工作特性)的術語，這種設備以成比例或連續方式進行工作，例如用於說明模擬放大器的工作特性不是離散的或數字的，而是模擬的。
sentence.english: Pertaining to a device that operates in a proportional or continuous manner, such as an analog amplifier. Not discrete or digital, but analog.

sentence.chinese: 她對這個建議的牴觸情緒已化為烏有了。
sentence.english: Her resistance to the proposal has crumpled.

sentence.chinese: 我們將在會議上討論這項提議。
sentence.english: We will discuss the proposal at the meeting.

sentence.chinese: 我提議為我們的友誼乾杯。
sentence.english: I wish to propose a toast to our friendship.

sentence.chinese: 他建議做一些改變。
sentence.english: He proposed that a change should be made.

word.chinese: [動詞] 向(女性)求歡; [名詞] 事業;提議;主題;求歡

sentence.chinese: 這和他早些時候提的建議截然相反。
sentence.english: This is the inverse of his earlier proposition.

sentence.chinese: 他的建議在理論上可以，但不能付諸實現。
sentence.english: His proposition is good in theory but cannot be put into practice.

sentence.chinese: 她的散文過於矯揉造作。
sentence.english: Her prose is far too mannered and self-conscious.

sentence.chinese: 這場戲大部分內容是用韻文寫成的，但也有一些是散文形式的。
sentence.english: Most of the scene is written in verse, but some is in prose.

sentence.chinese: 訴訟駁回由於原告沒將案件起訴或缺乏確鑿證據而作出對原告不利的判決
sentence.english: A judgment against a plaintiff for failure to prosecute the case or to introduce sufficient evidence.

sentence.chinese: 他鄭重宣佈將起訴他們犯有欺詐罪。
sentence.english: He vowed that he would prosecute them for fraud.

sentence.chinese: 控方律師詰問被告一方的證人。
sentence.english: The prosecution lawyer cross-examined the defence witness.

sentence.chinese: 近來有幾起毒品走私活動被檢舉立案。
sentence.english: There have been several successful prosecutions for drug smuggling recently.

sentence.chinese: 不公開刑事訴訟程序的有關一場審問的，其中一方既是原告又是法官
sentence.english: Relating to a trial in which one party acts as both prosecutor and judge.

sentence.chinese: 別用手指指著我，我不是在受審，你也不是原告！
sentence.english: Don't jab your finger at me: I'm not on trial and you're not the prosecutor!

word.chinese: [動詞] 勘探;找礦; [名詞] 預期;前途;盼望的事物

sentence.chinese: 我看他的情況沒有什麼改進的希望。
sentence.english: I see little prospect of an improvement in his condition.

sentence.chinese: 豐收在望。
sentence.english: A rich harvest is in prospect.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 預期的;盼望中的;未來的

sentence.chinese: 我希望您能對此予以迅速考慮，以便我能及時通知期待的客人。
sentence.english: I hope you can give this your immediate attention so that I can notify the prospective guests promptly.

sentence.chinese: 她嫁給了一個未來的律師。
sentence.english: She is married to a prospective lawyer.

sentence.chinese: 有了她當主管，公司開始興旺起來。
sentence.english: With her at the wheel, the company began to prosper.

sentence.chinese: 隨著新主席的到來，公司也開始有了起色。
sentence.english: With the advent of the new chairman, the company began to prosper.

word.chinese: [名詞] 興旺,繁榮,昌盛,成功

sentence.chinese: 帝國經過全盛以後逐漸衰落。
sentence.english: The empire was on the wane after its period of prosperity.

sentence.chinese: 奢侈商品銷售量日增是該國繁榮的標誌。
sentence.english: The increasing sale of luxury goods is an index of the country's prosperity.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 興旺的,繁榮的,昌盛的

sentence.chinese: 我國任何時候都沒有現在這樣繁榮。
sentence.english: At no time has the country been more prosperous than at present.

sentence.chinese: 這座古城在一個時期準是很繁榮的，因為它曾享有高度文明。
sentence.english: The city at one time must have been prosperous, for It enjoyed a high level of civilization.

word.chinese: [動詞] 使賣淫;濫用(才能等); [名詞] 娼妓

sentence.chinese: 夜間遊蕩的人夜間在街上遊蕩的人，尤指攔路搶劫者或妓女
sentence.english: One, especially a robber or prostitute, who walks the streets at night.

sentence.chinese: 她為養活子女而操皮肉生涯。
sentence.english: She prostituted herself in order to support her children.

sentence.chinese: 賣淫性關係的不道德，特指賣淫
sentence.english: Sexual immorality, especially prostitution.

sentence.chinese: 城裡賣淫活動越來越多。
sentence.english: Prostitution is on the increase in the city.

sentence.chinese: 這些勇敢的士兵會保衛我們的國家的。
sentence.english: These gallant soldiers will protect our country.

sentence.chinese: 騎士們衝向宮殿去保護國王。
sentence.english: The knights rushed into the palace to protect their king.

sentence.chinese: 我們定期捐款給一個動物保護基金會。
sentence.english: We subscribe to an animal protection society.

sentence.chinese: 我們社會的年輕人需要受到關懷和愛護。
sentence.english: The young in our society need careand protection.

sentence.chinese: 犰狳有角質鱗片的護甲。
sentence.english: The armadillo has a protective shell of bony plates.

sentence.chinese: 他用一隻手臂圍住她做出保護的姿勢。
sentence.english: He put his arm round her in a protective gesture.

sentence.chinese: 你需要增加蛋白質以增強體質。
sentence.english: You need more protein to build you up.

sentence.chinese: 素食者所攝取的蛋白質不是來自肉類而是來自近似肉類的食物。
sentence.english: A vegetarian gets protein not from meat but from its analogues.

word.chinese: [動詞] 抗議,反對; [名詞] 抗議,異議

sentence.chinese: 她堅持說她以前從未見過這一被指控的男子。
sentence.english: She protested that she had never seen the accused man before.

sentence.chinese: 他就人權問題提出的抗議聽來很空洞。
sentence.english: His protests on human rights sound hollow.

sentence.chinese: 原形早期的形式; 原形
sentence.english: An early form; a prototype.

sentence.chinese: 不管做多少次樣品，我們都無法獲得滿意的。
sentence.english: No matter how many prototype we make, we just can not get it right.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 感光榮的;驕傲的

sentence.chinese: 我們奪得獎盃那一天是值得我們驕傲的日子。
sentence.english: It was a proud day for us when we won the trophy.

sentence.chinese: 他現在忘乎所以了，覺得跟以前的朋友在一起有失他的臉面。
sentence.english: He is too proud now to be seen with his former friends.

sentence.chinese: 她斷定那筆錢用得不是地方，而我們在經濟上遇到的困難卻也似乎說明她言之有理。
sentence.english: She claimed that money had been wasted and our financial difficulties seemed to prove her point.

sentence.chinese: 採用老方法結果反而是某事物最好。
sentence.english: The old methods proved best after all.

sentence.chinese: 在這一方面我記得有一句諺語。
sentence.english: In this connection I remember a proverb.

sentence.chinese: 用一句諺語表示的
sentence.english: Expressed in a proverb.

sentence.chinese: 政府須為未來幾個月中可能出現的油荒作好準備。
sentence.english: The government has to provide against a possible oil shortage in the coming months.

sentence.chinese: 在你們的合同中已訂定有可能要翻譯這本書。
sentence.english: The possibility of the book being translated is provided for in your contract.

sentence.chinese: 報紙上的這篇文章為他的演講提供了啟發。
sentence.english: The newspaper article provided him with fuel for his speech.

sentence.chinese: 在我們的城市，許多社會服務仍然是有志願團體提供的。
sentence.english: Many social services are still provided by voluntary societies in our city.

sentence.chinese: 他當上了省長。
sentence.english: He established himself as governor of the province.

sentence.chinese: 這省經常發生騷亂。
sentence.english: Riots are of frequent occurrence in this province.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 省的;鄉氣的; [名詞] 地方居民;鄉下人

sentence.chinese: 鄉下人一個有鄉下觀念或習慣的人
sentence.english: A person who has provincial ideas or habits.

sentence.chinese: 這個人顯示出對戲劇界的守舊態度。
sentence.english: The man displayed provincial attitudes towards the theatre.

word.chinese: [動詞] 向...供應糧食(或必需品等); [名詞] 供應;預備;糧食

sentence.chinese: 現行的法律對此未作任何規定。
sentence.english: The present law makes no provision for this.

sentence.chinese: 他們為遠航的船隻準備了食品和必需品。
sentence.english: They provisioned the ship for a long voyage.

sentence.chinese: 隨信寄上一份暫定議事的日程安排供參考。
sentence.english: A copy of the provisional agenda in enclosed for your information.

sentence.chinese: 緩刑對已被認定犯有某罪的人實行暫緩執行其刑罰，並在其保證良好行為的基礎上給予暫時的自由
sentence.english: The act of suspending the sentence of a person convicted of a criminal offense and granting that person provisional freedom on the promise of good behavior.

sentence.chinese: 哈里自稱是一名無政府主義者，但是他實際上只是在裝腔作勢以引起人們的議論。
sentence.english: Harry claims to be an anarchist but he's really only striking an attitude to be provocative.

sentence.chinese: 這種有傾向性的說法可能招致強烈的反對。
sentence.english: Such tendentious statements are likely to provoke strong opposition.

sentence.chinese: 許多不能給別人指路找到街角上的藥行的人，到了年紀使他更加糊塗之後，卻也會找到人必恭必敬地聆聽他的申訴。
sentence.english: Many a man that can not direct you to a corner drugstore will get a respectful hearing when age have further impair his mind.

sentence.english: Many a man that can't direct you to a corner drugstore will get a respectful hearing when age has further impaired his mind.

sentence.english: A binary-coded decimal code for representing decimal numbers in which each decimal digit is represented by seven binary digits which are coefficients of 8,6,4,2,0,1,0, respectively.

sentence.chinese: 對教育工作者提出的要求，就是要調整學校的課程來最大限度地使用新的技術，以便學生能夠學得更好，並為他們現在所面臨的信息豐富的世界而早作準備。

word.chinese: [動詞] 發生,產生;結果;導致; [名詞] 結果

word.chinese: [形容詞] 顛倒的;相反的;反向的; [動詞] 翻轉;倒退;反向; [名詞] 相反;反面;反向

sentence.english: The 50p coin has a crowned lion on its reverse.

sentence.english: He reversed the coin and examined it carefully.

sentence.english: The government is reviewing the situation.

sentence.chinese: 米斯特拉爾，弗雷德裡克1830－1914法國作家及復興普羅旺斯語為文學語言運動的領導人，1904年與他人分享諾貝爾文學獎
sentence.english: French writer and leader in the revival of Provenal as a literary language. He shared the 1904 Nobel Prize for literature.

word.chinese: [動詞] 復甦;恢復生機;使甦醒

word.chinese: [動詞] 旋轉;自轉;以...為中心

sentence.chinese: 我的工作是我生活的中心。

word.chinese: [動詞] 酬謝;獎勵; [名詞] 報答;報償;獎賞

sentence.english: They promised to make it worth her while (ie pay or reward her) if she would take part.

sentence.english: By rights, half the reward should be mine.

word.chinese: [動詞] 重寫;改寫; [名詞] 重寫;改寫

sentence.english: I rewrote the article because it do not according with our policy.

sentence.chinese: 揭掉那一套競選政綱的花言巧語，你還剩下什麼？
sentence.english: Strip off the platform rhetoric and what you are left with?

sentence.english: One whose conduct, thought, or rhetoric is governed by emotion rather than reason, often as a matter of policy.

word.chinese: [形容詞] 修辭學的;誇張的

sentence.chinese: 輕描淡寫的陳述在表達上受限制或缺乏強調，如為了修辭作用
sentence.english: Restraint or lack of emphasis in expression, as for rhetorical effect.

sentence.english: Tear off the rhetorical topdressing from his speech and you find there's very little solid content.

sentence.chinese: 獵物保護區管理員用麻醉射器讓犀牛靜了下來。
sentence.english: The game warden tranquillize the rhinoceros with a drug dart.

sentence.chinese: 獵物保護區管理員用麻醉射器讓犀牛靜了下來。
sentence.english: The game wardens tranquillized the rhinoceros with a drugged dart.

word.chinese: [動詞] 押韻; [名詞] 韻,韻腳

sentence.english: Stress and rhythm are important in speaking English.

sentence.english: The rhythmic pattern of a stanza, determined by the kind and number of lines.

sentence.english: The rhythmic stamping of the heels characteristic of Spanish flamenco dances.

word.chinese: [動詞] 裝肋於;嘲弄; [名詞] 肋骨;排骨

sentence.english: A protruding rim, edge, rib, or collar, as on a wheel or a pipe shaft, used to strengthen an object, hold it in place, or attach it to another object.

sentence.chinese: 那老人戴著單片眼鏡，上面連結著一條絲帶。

sentence.chinese: 儘管有大量的宗教派別，研究美國宗教慣常做法的學者發現，在許多情況下，許多新教教派之間在信仰方面並沒有多大的不同，只是在儀式方面有較小的差異。

sentence.english: A set of ceremonies prescribed for an occasion; a ritual.

sentence.english: He used to roam the street for hour on end.
